В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чинара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Чинара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Chinara is 44 years old and raising 3 children.  In 1996 she took up farming and animal husbandry as a source of income.  He business, which she began with 15,000 soms (KGS), now brings her an income of about 10,000 some (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy and meat products.  Chinara also cultivates cereal crops and esparcet on 2.44ha of land.  Thanks to her hard work, Chinara has one milking cow, one calf, and one bull calf.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chinara applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan 40,000 soms (KGS) for purchasing livestock.  Chinara is planning to invest the income in further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos que están en las edades de 19 y 23 años, en la hermosa Cartagena de Indias,  ciudad  localizada a orillas del mar Caribe y  segundo centro urbano en importancia de la Costa Caribe colombiana, después de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene  un negocio que inició su padre vendiendo cerveza entre sus amigos cercanos del barrio, luego cuando su padre se pensionó,  ella tomó su negocio y fortaleció su clientela adicionándole calzado deportivo a su línea de ventas y estos como se sienten satisfechos  la refieren , por eso su negocio ha crecido. Sus aspiraciones son ampliarlo,  porque su demanda también cada día se incrementa. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, cervezas y para provisionarse y vender mucho mas  y también comprará calzado sobre pedidos de sus clientes. El éxito de su inversión es que tienen inventarios oportunos,  para responderle a su clientela de las bebidas  y porque su inversión de calzado es para cumplirle a pedidos de sus mas fieles clientes.  Su sueño mas adelante es tener un estadero donde sus clientes puedan recrearse y compartir, pero su mayor desafío es lograr el capital de trabajo para alcanzar sus sueños y progresar con sus dos hijos, con quienes sueña   ver convertidos en personas exitosas.
texts.en: Maria is 43 and lives with her two children who are 19 and 23, in the beautiful Cartagena de Indias, a city located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea and the second-most important urban center on the Colombian Caribbean coast, after the city of Barranquilla.  There she has a business that her father started selling beer among his close friends in the neighborhood.  When her father retired, she took over his business and strengthened its clientele, adding athletic shoes to her sales.  Her customers are satisfied, so they refer others to her, so her business has grown.  Her aspirations are to expand her business because her demand increases every day.  This is why she applied for her Kiva loan, which is the first financing she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy beer in larger volumes to supply her business and to be able to sell a lot more.  She will also buy shoes based on her customers' orders.  The success of her investment is that there is timely inventory to respond to her customers' demand for drinks and because her investment in shoes is to fill the orders of her most loyal cusotmers.  Her dream for the future is to have a tavern where her customers can enjoy themselves and share, but her biggest challenge is to obtain the working capital to reach her dreams and to be able to progress with her two children, who she wants to see become successful people.

loans.use: to buy beer in larger volume to supply her business and to be able to sell much more.  She will also buy shoes to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Anmassika Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe  Anmassika sont mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec  en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Donsobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de savons, de gousses d’arachide, de galettes de niébé, de pain et des légumes (choux pommés). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kadiatou (femme debout en 1ère position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du savon dans le village de Donsobougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 cartons de savon. Elle se ravitaille en savon au grand marché  de Ségou. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer. A  l’instar des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour ambition d’acheter une charrette qui lui servira de moyens de transport entre les foires.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Anmassika are married and mostly from monogamous families. The group members average 39 years of age and five children per woman. They all live in the village of Donsobougou, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali), and they know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They work in small-scale commerce involving soaps, peanuts, cakes made from black-eyed peas, bread, and vegetables (savoy cabbages). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan.

Ms. Kadiatou (the woman standing first in line from left to right, in the photo) is famous for selling soap in and around the village of Donsobougou. She plans on using her loan to buy 4 boxes of soap. She resupplies herself with soap from the big market in Ségou. She accepts cash or credit in her sales to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and to ensure the children are cared for at home. Just like the other women of the group, her ambition is to buy a cart as a means of transport between markets.

loans.use: to buy some soap

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Ruth tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañada. Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar oficios domésticos en su casa, es una persona honesta, responsable, con valores y principios posee buena reputación en la comunidad, es una familia unida, luchadora. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una ternera (ganado bovino) en el tiangue de la plaza de la ciudad. De esta manera ella crecerá la ternera hasta que reproduzca, para ordeñarla y tener productos lácteos para la venta y para consumo personal. Para obtener ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

La señora Ruth, desea continuar trabajando con la Fundación Campo, mejorar la casa,  brindarle mejor vida a su familia, tener un buen ato de ganado, elaborar productos lácteos para la venta o consumo y ahorrar de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and is married. All her life she has been a housewife. She is a very honest and responsible person with values and principles. She has a good reputation in the community. Her family is very close-knit and strong-willed to work for what they want.

The loan that she has requested through 'Fundación Campo', is to buy a calf  in the cattle market in the city. Her plan is to raise the calf until she is able to reproduce, so that she can milk her and have milk products to sell and use for personal consumption. This will allow her to generate income and improve the quality of life for her family. 

Ruth's goals are to continue working with the 'Fundación Campo', to improve her home, to provide a better life to her family, to have a good place to keep her calf, to make milk products to sell and consume and to save her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Mario Gustavo

texts.es: El cliente Mario Gustavo, es un señor de 23 años de edad, es soltero, trabaja en una empresa de Criadores y engorde de ganados lecheros en la ciudad de Cochabamba, que  queda ubicado en la zona este de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona este, aproximadamente a 8 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia y de su familia, el cliente vive con su Madre y sus hermanos, el destino del  crédito de la  es para la refacción de su vivienda, la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento,  es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Mario Gustavo is 23 years old and single. He works in a business that breeds and raises milk cows that is located in the eastern part of the city of Cochabamba. He currently lives in the eastern region of the city which is 8 kn from the city center of Cochabamba. The house where he lives is owned by his family. He lives with his mom and his siblings. He will use the loan to make repairs to the house. It is very rundown due to the weather and the moisture that collects at the bottom of the walls caused by the constant rain in the city. It is now rainy season and the house needs to be repaired.  We have told you this information about Mario so that you can know more about his situation.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Woegan

texts.fr:
Woegan est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Woegan travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des objets en plastique et des produits d’alimentation pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec 01 personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Woegan a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des objets en plastique et des produits d’alimentation. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Woegan voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Woegan is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a retiree and has three children who go to school. The first child is 15 years old, and the last, 7 years old. 

Woegan has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells plastic ware and grocery items out of her home to all comers. She purchases the goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works with one person. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage.

Woegan has requested a second loan from WAGES to buy plastic products and grocery items. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. She says she plans on using the profits to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware and more

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia tiene 34 años y es viuda  no tiene  hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y  de accesorios de ropa en un tienda  que se encuentran en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad,  Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Claudia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería ropa y accesorios por mayor para surtir su tienda con ropa de temporada,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería en menos precio. La Sra. Claudia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son expandir su mercado y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar su capital  de trabajo, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia,  La Sra. Claudia es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas de superación, agradecida con la institución por l apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Claudia is 34 years old and is a widow, without children. She makes a living selling clothing and clothing accessories in a store that is located in a very busy area of the city. This is the second loan she has taken out through the institution. She will use this loan to buy merchandise, clothing and accessories, at wholesale to stock her store with appropriate styles for the season. The reason she has requested a loan is so that she can buy stock at lower prices (by purchasing at wholesale). She is facing challenges in her business as she is trying to grow it and increase her market. She will use the extra profits from her increased business to increase her working capital which will allow her to improve her profits and therefore improve the quality of life for her whole family. Claudia is a young entrepreneur with desires to rise above. She is thankful for the support that the institution has provided.

loans.use: to buy clothing and clothing accessories.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan trabajador, buen esposo tiene sus proyectos de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda así ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, sigue trabajando como guardia de seguridad y hasta la fecha ha logrado ir construyendo poco a poco su casa con el apoyo de Afodenic que ha estado de la mano con sus proyectos. En ciclo de este año el préstamo se utilizara para la nivelación y levantamiento del piso del garaje comprando materiales de construcción como: cementos, arena, piedrín,  entre otros materiales. 
Agrade a la financiera ya que mediante su apoyo continuo ha logrado algunos planes y logra todos sus proyectos futuros que su vez obtendrá seguridad, comodidad para su familia.
texts.en: Juan is a hard worker and a good husband. He is currently working on home improvement projects to improve the infrastructure of his home, to be able to offer better living conditions to his children. He is still working as a security guard. Up to this date he has succeeded in building his house little by little with the support of 'Afodenic', who has been giving him a hand with his projects. In the loan cycle of this year he will use the money to level and lift the floor of the garage. He will buy construction materials like: cement, sand and gravel, amongst other things. He is thankful to the lenders, through their continuous support he is able to succeed in his plans and finish the projects that will provide security and comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She runs an electrical and electronics workshop which has been operating for the last seven years. Margaret started the business from the little savings she had. The desire for increased credit led her to join Milango.

Margaret is applying for a loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase stocks of electronic tax register machines and spare parts. Most businesses require tax registers in compliance with government regulations on income tax.   Margaret believes the business has a bright future and that she will be able to import tax registers for sale in the future. 

This business faces a challenge from inflation within the country that has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. The additional income from this business will also help Margaret buy more business assets.

loans.use: buy electronic tax register machines and spare parts

loans.name: Mwambui

texts.en:
Mwambui is a single mother living in Mariakani town, Kenya. She runs a tailoring shop that has been offering services to her neighbors for four years. She previously cooked and sold buns. which helped her raise the capital to purchase a sewing machine and began sewing. 

Mwambui was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase clothing materials and other accessories for ladies’ wear.

Mwambui is optimistic that she can proceed with the business and build a business premise which will not demand rent at the end of every month. The additional income from this loan will help her pay her daughter’s school fees, despite the challenge of a seasonal business climate and the inflation.

loans.use: buy sewing materials and accessories

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She started the business from her personal savings and and salary. Victoria owns a boutique which has been running for eight years. She is married and has three children.

Victoria was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase children’s clothes, ladies’ clothes and “lessos/khangas” (cover clothes worn during hot seasons).

The additional income from this loan will help Victoria pay for her children’s school fees, provide health care and invest in securities/bonds for the future needs of her family.  Her challenge is lack of reliable clients and the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder 3 Group

texts.en:
Daniry is one of the members of the group Mujer al Poder 3, which is made up of five hardworking women who are committed to work and to change their families' lives and their community. This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, a community with few resources located north of the capital of the Dominican Republic. 

Daniry is a single woman with three children. She runs a business selling cosmetic products. She has been selling these products for over 4 years.  She started this business because she felt the need to produce to sustain her children. She started selling catalog products and now she sells different brands. 

Daniry is receiving her 4th loan and she is very excited to receive it, because after taking loans from Esperanza International, she has been able to increase her sales and inventory. Her plan for the future is to have a store where she can sell these products and many others. She is very thankful for all your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a farmer and also runs a salon at the local market in her home area in Kitale.  She is 23 years old and still single.  She has been in farming for only one year.  Her maize products are sold in the local market. 

Mwajuma has requested a loan of  57,200 KES from  Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow.  This will help generate income and make savings for her future life. She remains very optimistic that she will be able to establish a farm of at least three dairy cows in five years.

Mwajuma has great concern over the lack of proper markets for farm produce during peak seasons within the local markets. Her major issue is poor market prices during such times.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Goribaa

texts.fr:
Goribaa est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 14 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Goribaa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Goribaa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Goribaa voudrait diversifier  ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Goribaa is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a welder and has four children who go to school. The first child is 14 years old, and the last, 7 years old. Goribaa has been working as a retailer since 2010. She sells grocery items out of her home to all comers. She purchases the goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage. 

Goribaa has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy some grocery items. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the next few years, Goribaa would like to diversify her merchandise. She says she plans on using the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Rosa Bertilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 46 años, ella es una persona muy luchadora dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de abarrotería como frijoles, arroz, manteca y otros, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace 3años, junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos y su esposo, quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos. Su negocio esta en un punto de fácil acceso para cada uno de sus clientes, ya que esta ubicado en la calle principal y no tiene competencia, y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda de productos. El crédito que se le otorgo lo invirtió para la compra de maíz, frijoles, aceite, carnes, embutidos, pan, refrescos etc. el impacto que tuvo con el financiamiento, ella ahora a podido abastecer su negocio y así poder satisfacer la demanda de productos los cuales le hacen a diario sus clientes, como también generarse mejores ingresos para darle una buena educación a sus hijos. Doña Rosa tiene planes a futuro de hacer  crecer más su negocio, y comprar un carro para poder transportar sus productos.



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, is very much a fighter, a person dedicated to her own business, which is selling groceries such as beans, rice, lard, and others, a job she has done in her home for three years.  Also living with her are her two children and her husband, who supports her in every one of her commitments.  Her business is at a point of easy access for each of her customers because it is located on the main street and has no competition, and this creates a lot of demand for products.

She invested the loan she was granted in buying corn, beans, oil, meat, cold cuts, bread, soft drinks, etc.  The impact she had from the loan was that now she has been able to supply her business and so satisfy the requests for products that her clients make of her every day, as well as generate better income for herself to give her children a good education.

Rosa has future plans to make her business grow more and to buy a car to be able to transport her products.

Choluteca, Honduras--March 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, meat, cold cuts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es: Celestina, actualmente labora para una empresa privada en el area de ventas, continua contando con el apoyo de su esposo. La señora en virtud de contribuir al desarrollo de su vivienda  y de sus pequeños hijos el destino que tendra su credito en esta oportunidad sera para comprar materiales de construccion como: bloques; hierro, arena, cemento y otros; cuyo fin es cerrar la pared de la sala, costado oeste y asi brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna; agradece el apoyo otorgado por la micro-financiera y kiva.
texts.en: Celestina is currently working for a private company in the area of sales and continues to have the support of her husband. In order to contribute to the development of her home and to her small children, she will use this loan to buy construction materials, like: cinder blocks, rod iron, sand, cement and other things. The end goal is to finish the outer wall of the living room on the westend of the house. This will allow her to provide her family with a house they can be proud of. She is thankful for the support given to her by the micro lenders and kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Veronica.  She is married and has 3 children aged 16, 11 and 3 years. She has 1 additional dependent.  

In 2002, Veronica established her provisions and drinks business.  She began her business because she was unable to further her education and needed a source of living.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

Veronica would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  She requires this loan in order to buy more provisions wholesale at a reduced rate.   In the future, Veronica plans to expand her business and educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drinks and provisions

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Alieu.  He is married and has no child.   He has 4 dependents living with him.  In 1996, Alieu established his provisions, drinks and cement items business. He began this business when he realized that if he is out of job, he needs to engage himself in something profitable. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Alieu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.   He requires this loan in order to buy more drinks for his business.  In the future, Alieu plans to become an international business man.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 39-year-old business man.  He is married to Mary, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been a charcoal distributor for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff.  He will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal.   With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to build a store for storing the charcoal.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Caodat

texts.ru: Саодат в возрасте 22 лет,замужем ,имеет сына.Саодат умная,пунктуальная и успешная женщина,знаток своего дела.Не смотря на молодость,она трудолюбивая и ответственная .Саодат очень любит детей ,поэтому она начала заниматься продажей детской одежды.С 2010 года она начала кредитоваться в нашей  организации и достигла больших успехов.А ее муж занимается купле продажей скота и помогает ей по бизнесу.На полученный кредит она хочет закупить весенний товар.Саодат благодарна нашей организации.
texts.en: Caodat is 22 years old, married, and has a son.  Caodat is a smart, punctual, and successful woman; and an expert in her field.  Regardless of her youth, she is hardworking and responsible.  Caodat loves children very much and, because of this, began selling children's clothes.  Her husband, who trades in cattle, helps her with the business.  She has been borrowing from our organization since 2010 and has achieved great success.  With the loan she receives, Caodat wants to buy Spring merchandise.  Caodat is grateful to our organization.

loans.use: to buy Spring merchandise

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr:
Délali est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Délali travaille comme revendeuse de friperies depuis 2008. Elle exerce seule au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. Elle sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des vêtements pour enfants. Elle veut d’autres articles en friperie (sacs, chaussures et autres) 
Dans les prochaines années, Délali voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de vêtements. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Délali is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer and has two children, one of whom attends school. The first child is 15 years old, and the last, 3 years old. Délali has been working as a seller of second-hand clothing since 2008. She works alone at the market and stocks up in Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy some children's clothing. She wants other used items (handbags, shoes, and more). 

In the next few years, Délali would like to open a store for selling clothing. She says she plans on making sure her children have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Gertrudis Janna

texts.es: Gertrudis  de 58 años vive en santa elena.  Ella  heredo de su madre el negocio que es de vender ropa  . trabaja todos los días sola porque es soltera no ha sufrido ningún robo en su  negocio. su meta es de tener un local grande en el centro  para poder mejorar su situación económica. Ella con el préstamo comprara (ropa perfumes cosméticos)
texts.en: Gertrudis, 58, lives in Santa Elena.  She inherited a business from her mother where she sells clothing.  She works alone each day, because she is single.  Her business has never been robbed.  Her goal is to have a big store in the center of town where she could improve her economic situation.  With this loan, she will buy clothing, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: July Andreina

texts.es: JULY de 19 años escogio esta actividad de hacer visuterias desde que lo aprendió en el colegio.ella decidió ponerse su propio negocio en casa aparte ella realiza el trabajo de cuidar cerdos y patos.july se dedica sola a su trabajo porque es soltera. ella con el pasar del tiempo quiere ponerce su propia empresa ya que quiere tener una familia y poder solventarla con su trabajo. con el préstamo comprara mercadería  como (vitrina accesorios cerdos y pato)
texts.en: July, 19, chose the activity of making costume jewelry since she learned how in school.  She decided to open her own business at home.  She also cares for pigs and ducks.  July works alone because she's single.  In time she wants to start her own firm because she wants to have a family and be able to support it with her work.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like a display case, accessories, pigs and ducks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, display cases, accessories, pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorreti  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with 5 children, only two of them are in school. She also helps additional family members.  

Gorreti sells charcoal and bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years.  She works seven days a week. 

Gorreti has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to villages for charcoal and bananas. 

Gorreti lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes medication, rent and school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Margretta

texts.en:
Margretta is 21 years old and married with 1 child.   She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

Margretta needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to continue improving her business.

Margretta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Margretta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Feauma

texts.en:
Feauma is 50 and married with 5 children. She is starting a business venture -- baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.    

Feauma needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase cooking ingredients in bulk.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 Talas per week) to support the immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Feauma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Feauma's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques les dix femmes du groupe Bendiya ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Beni dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de savon, des ustensiles en plastiques, des condiments alimentaires (pâtes d’arachide et huile d’arachide), de mil, d’arachide et de la bouillie. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Sitan (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  céréales de toutes qualités dans le village de Beni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de mil à la foire de Cinzana Gare. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Sitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. Madame. A l’image des autres clientes du groupe, elle a pour ambition de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
All married and mostly in polygamous families, the ten women of the group Bendiya average 36 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Beni, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They buy and sell soap, plastic utensils, condiments (peanut butter and peanut oil), millet, peanuts, and porridge. 

With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan.

Ms. Sitan (the second woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a major seller of grains of all qualities in and around the village of Beni. She plans on using her loan to buy 2 sacks of millet at the fair in Cinzana Gare. Cash or credit is accepted for sales to a customer base composed of men and women.

With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to take care of her household needs for food. 

Just like the other clients of the group, her ambition is to raise small ruminants in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy some millet

loans.name: Marlon Ivan

texts.es:
Marlon Iván tiene 30 años, es casado su esposa se dedica a los trabajos del hogar,  tiene 3 hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años de edad solo el mayor esta estudiando, vive con su familia en el departamento de Santa Barbará, Honduras.
Marlon su actividad económica es la agricultura específicamente el cultivo del café. El le ayudaba a su padre con los trabajos del cultivo y con la experiencia que obtuvo decidió independizarse hace 14 años. Su padre le heredo media  manzana de tierra para comenzar a cultivar lo propio. El manifiesta que desde entonces le ha ido bien con la venta del café ya que el precio de este producto se mantiene y de las ganancias obtenidas las ha reinvertido en cultivar mas. Aumentando los  recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia. El trabaja desde muy temprano en sus cultivos 6 días a la semana.
El esta muy agradecido con ODEF por brindarle la oportunidad de un financiamiento por la cantidad de 12,000 lempiras el cual piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizante, mantenimiento y limpieza  de la finca. Con esta inversión el piensa obtener mas ingresos de los cuales destinara en la educación de sus hijos. 
Su meta es cultivar más tierras y sacar buenas cosechas y heredar a sus hijos un patrimonio económico.
texts.en:
Marlon Iván, 30, is married; his wife does household chores.  He has three children who are 8, 4 and 2 years old; only the oldest is attending school.  He lives with his family in Santa Barbará Department, Honduras.

Marlon’s economic activity is farming, specifically coffee growing.  He helped his father with farming chores and with the experience he obtained he decided to become independent 14 years ago.  His father passed down half a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] to him to start his own crops.  He states that since then he’s done well with the coffee sales since the price of coffee stays steady and he’s reinvested the profits he’s earned to plant more thus increasing resources needed to support his family.  He works on his crops starting very early six days a week.

He’s very grateful to ODEF for providing him with a 12,000 lempira loan that he intends to use to buy fertilizer, for crop maintenance and to clear and weed his fields.  With this investment he plans to earn more income that he’ll use toward his children’s education.  His goal is to farm more land and produce good harvests to have an economic estate to pass on to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear and weed his farm.

loans.name: Berta Josefa

texts.es: Bertha de 44 años vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 18 a 22 años. Su negocio de peluquería lo inició desde el año 2005, para buscar estabilidad laboral, así fue como apoyada por su esposo quien le dio su primer capital, inicio la implementación de su peluquería en una habitación de su propia casa, desde donde ha crecido. Ella ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal a cada cliente, por eso su  meta  de estudiar cosmetología le permitirá ampliar su cobertura empresarial,  hacia otras líneas y nuevos clientes, para lo cual requiere acondicionar locativamente  su negocio. Sus planes de crecimiento son inagotables pero su capital de trabajo para responder a sus sueños, se torna insuficiente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará herramientas de peluquería, e insumos para responde de manera mas efectiva a sus clientes e iniciar su sueño de crecimiento.
texts.en: Bertha, 44, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband.  They have 2 children aged 18 and 22 years.  Her business is a hair salon, which she started up in 2005, seeking job stability.  She had the support of her husband, who gave her the initial capital to work with.  She started by setting up a beauty salon in a room in her house, and from this her business grew.  Bertha offers beauty services for each customer.  Her goal is to study cosmetology so that she could expand her business, add other lines of business and new customers.  To do this, she needs to better equip her business.  Her growth plans are inexhaustible, but her working capital is not adequate for her dreams.  This is the reason that she came to apply for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the proceeds to purchase equipment for her beauty salon and supplies, so that she can respond more effectively to her customers and start realizing her dreams for growth.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 24 years old and has been in farming for four years.  He is married and has two children, aged five and two years. His farm produces vegetables, fruits and eggs, which he sells in the local market to help him meet his daily family upkeep.  He also works as a motorcycle pilot which helps him supplement the farming income.

Willy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry farming by buying more birds.  He remains optimistic that he will get enough income to venture into dairy farming as well within the next five years. He wants to afford better living standards for his family and believes farming is the way to realize his dreams.

Willy has hopes that the Juhudi Kilimo loan will be of great benefit.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes (Brave women) 1, located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she sells chicken, pork, beef and meat sausages. She will use the profits to buy a battery for her power generator and to save to buy her own house. She said that her most difficult challenge is to travel, as she would like to visit other countries like Hawaii.  This is one of her most cherished dream as she wants to meet other cultures. Her future plans are to have her own house, to have a successful and sustainable business, and then to travel to different countries.

She started doing her business almost three years ago with some money she saved, and she is taking Esperanza´s loan because they are comfortable to do business with. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Quiton

texts.en:
Quilton is 31 years old and runs a farm in his home area in Kitale, Western Kenya, where he has been practicing his farming business actively for the last four years.  He currently produces eggs and vegetables. He also rides a motorcycle for additional income.

Quilton has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds to improve the income from his poultry business. He says the income will  help him pay for the education of his children.

Quilton says the challenge in farming remains the high costs of treatment for  birds.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is a 40-year-old woman who is married with 5 children.  She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

Malama  needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to continue improving her land.

Malama  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Malama 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est un homme âgé  de 28ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse avec 02 enfants en charge.
Komi travaille comme frigoriste(il répare et vend les frigidaires) depuis 2008. Il exerce son activité avec 03 personnes dans un quartier de la place et s’approvisionne au Port Autonome de Lomé.
Komi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des congélateurs, des réfrigérateurs. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité et s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Komi is a 28-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has two children to support. He has been working as a refrigerator expert (he repairs and sells Frigidaires) since 2008. He operates with three persons in a local neighborhood and stocks up at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. 

Komi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy freezers and refrigerators. He wants to reinvest in his business and to thrive.

loans.use: to buy freezers and refrigerators

loans.name: Ma Orbelinda

texts.es:
Ma Orbelinda tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos entre 23 y 14 años de edad, vive con su familia en Taulabe, Comayagua.
Ma Orbelinda tiene su propio negocio de una pequeña pulpería. La cual inicio con fondos propios hace un año. Y ofrece a sus clientes productos alimenticios, como Frijoles, arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, golosinas, refrescos, y también productos de abarrotería como jabón, pastas, detergentes, etc. Ella obtuvo este negocio impulsada por la situación de falta de empleo para poder generar ingresos que ayudaran a los gastos diarios del hogar. Ella atiende su pulpería desde muy temprano.
Solicito un préstamo con ODEF de 5,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de productos alimenticios como maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, harina, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas. Para incrementar el inventario y por consiguiente generar mejores ingresos.
Su meta es mejorar el local del negocio, poder hacerlo mas amplio y seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos necesarios.
texts.en:
María Orbelinda, 42, is married and her husband works in agriculture; she has four children whose ages range between 23 and 14 years.  She lives with her family in Taulabe, Comayagua.

María Orbelinda has her own business, a small grocery store.  She started it a year ago with her own funds.  She sells food items like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lard, snacks and soft-drinks and also grocery items like soap, toothpaste, detergent, etc.

She went into this business motivated by the lack of employment opportunities and the need she had to help cover everyday household expenses.  She tends to her store starting very early.

She asked ODEF for a 5,000 lempira loan to buy food items like corn, beans, rice, sugar, flour, sugar, soft-drinks and snacks to increase inventory and as a result generate better income.  Her goal is to strengthen her business, to be able to make it larger and to continue forward and help her family with necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: David Leonardo

texts.es:
David de 25 años, quien está casado desde hace un año, vive junto a su esposa en Olanchito, yoro.
Anteriormente David trabajaba como técnico en un laboratorio dental donde adquirió mucha experiencia y hace tres años se independizo creando su propio laboratorio dental. 
El ofrece servicio de elaboración de placas dentales, prótesis y placas provisionales. Atiende a sus clientes durante 6 horas diarias, todos los días.
Es su primer préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en compra de materia prima para la elaboración de placas dentales, con el propósito de brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes 
Su sueño es comprar más equipo y tener en existencia los materiales necesarios para desempeñarse mejor en los productos que hace.
texts.en:
David, 25, has been married for a year; he lives with his wife in Olanchito, Yoro.

David used to work as a technician in a dental lab where he acquired much experience and three years ago he became independent and opened his own dental lab.  He makes dentures, prostheses and temporary dentures.  He tends to customers every day for six hours daily.

This is his first loan request and he will use it to buy raw materials to make dentures aiming at providing better customer service.  His dream is to buy more equipment and have the necessary materials on hand to better make the products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make dentures.

loans.name: Seydi Xiomara

texts.es:
La joven Seydi, es soltera, con 27 años de edad,  no tiene hijos, no tiene dependientes, con domicilio en el Barrio San José, trabaja junto con sus hermanas y su mama en la venta de tacos, enchiladas, tajadas de mínimo verde y otras golosinas. El negocio de la joven Seydi es la venta de Golosinas y también  almuerzos. Esta solicitando préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, maíz, refrescos, para mejorar un poco mas su negocio, ya que de esta manera lograra mayor ingreso en sus ventas y su negocio tendrá un poco mas de afluencia de clientes. La joven Seydi  es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable lucha por sobresalir con su negocio ya que tiene la actitud de comerciante, es muy emprendedora, responsable, honesta, esta solicitando ya su tercer crédito con PRISMA  de Honduras.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo - 2012
texts.en:
This young woman, Seydi, is single and 27 years old. She does not have children or dependents and she lives in the San José neighborhood. She works together with her mother and sisters, selling tacos, enchiladas, sliced green plantains, and candies. Seydi's business is selling candies and lunches. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meat, corn, and soft drinks in order to improve her business a bit, as she will be able to earn more income this way and her business will see an influx of customers. Young Seydi is a very hard-working and responsible person who fights to improve her business, as she has the attitude of a businesswoman. She is very enterprising, responsible, and honest. She is requesting her third loan through PRISMA of Honduras.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March - 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, corn, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Everson

texts.es:
El señor Everson, es  casado, con 29 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo que depende el, vive en casa de sus familiares junto con su hijo y su esposa en la comunidad de San Antonio, su esposa es maestra y también trabaja para brindar mas apoyo a su familia.
Su negocio es una pulpería y una farmacia, en la que vende productos como frijoles, arroz, manteca, maíz y  abarrotería en general; también vende medicamentos populares como ser panadol , alka seltzer, dolofin , suero, curas, vendas, alcohol, algodón , Nervo forza, vitaminas, entre otros.
Esta solicitando su segundo crédito a un plazo de 4 meses para la compra de granos básicos y medicamentos para surtir su negocio de esta manera lograr mayores ganancias y acaparar mas clientes para que su negocio se fortalezca cada día mas.
Entre los planes de Everson esta la idea de colocar una nueva sucursal de su negocio en el centro y también comprar un terreno para construir una casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo - 2012
texts.en:
Everson is 29 years old, married, and has a dependent child.  He lives in his relative's house along with his child and wife, in the community of San Antonio.  His wife is a teacher, and also works to provide more support to his family.  

Everson has a grocery store/pharmacy, where he sells products including beans, rice, butter, corn, and general grocery items.  He also sells popular medicines such as Panadol (acetaminophen), alka seltzer, ibuprofen, saline solution, bandages, rubbing alcohol, cotton, vitamins and other products.  

He is requesting his second loan, for a duration of 4 months, to purchase staple grains and medicines to stock his store.  This way he will have better earnings and can capture more customers, making his business stronger day by day.

Among Everson's plans is the idea of establishing a new branch of his business in the town center, and also buying some land where he could build his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - March 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, corn and other products for his business

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 61 years old and is a mother of seven children, aged between 24 and 12, with five still schooling.  She has been in farming for six years in her rural home in Kitale in Western Kenya.  Her farm produces milk, eggs and maize for the local market.

Loice has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is her second loan after a first one of 30,000 KES.  She will use this loan to buy more poultry birds to boost her poultry business.  She plans to have a farm with at least one thousand birds at a time and rank as a major supplier of eggs for the local market.  She adds that the income will help in educating her children.

Loice appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services to farmers but notes that diseases remain a real challenge to them.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Boniface, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been running a cafe where he sells juice, water, milk, sodas and food like vitumbua, mandazi and  chapati, for one year now.  He works from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more juice, sodas and milk. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Boniface will share this loan with his loan group "Tegemeo," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy juice, sodas and milk.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es: La señora Celia, mujer emprendedora, responsable y eforzada continua en su oficio de costurera en su casa de habitacion, siendo Afodenic y Kiva los medios de financiamiento ella agradece la confianza dada a su persona. En esta ocasión la razon de su credito es para realizar las compras de los siguientes marteriales de construccion: zinc, estandares, perlines, cemento, golosos, soldadura entre otros y de esa manera llevar a cabo la construccion de su cuarto y un bajarate para la parte en donde se encuentra ubicado el lavandero de su vivienda ; Celia tiene pensado que de aquí  a un tiempo ir haciendole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en:
Celia, an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman, continues in her job as a seamstress in her house.  With financing from AFODENIC and Kiva, she is grateful for the confidence given to her.

This time the reason for her loan is to buy the following construction materials: corrugated metal roofing, pennants, gravel, cement, screws, and solder, among others.  In this way she will carry out building her room and wattle and daub for the part of the house where the washing area is located.

Celia is planning to continue making improvements on her home in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her room and wattle and daub.

loans.name: Maria Claribel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51  años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 13 años de edad, el menor estudia y al otro ya es independiente, ella vive con sus familia en el Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene una actividad de un negocio de venta de comida. Inicio este negocio hace 25 años dando el servicio de venta de almuerzos a personal de varias empresas de los alrededores. Maria manifiesta que siempre le ha gustado el negocio de la venta de comida y eso la motivo a trabajar en el y aparte que es un negocio muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias. Dedicándose desde las 9.00 am hasta la 12.00pm.
Es su segundo préstamo con ODEF de 9,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar productos alimenticios como carne, y otros insumos como leña, papel toalla, etc. para la elaboración de los alimentos.
Su meta es apoyar a su hija para que pueda terminar sus estudios, y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 51, is married and has two children who are 22 and 13 years of age; the youngest attends school and the other one is independent already.  She lives with her family in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

María’s business activity is food sales.  She started this business 25 years ago selling lunches to staff in various nearby firms.  María states that she’s always enjoyed the business of food sales and this motivated her to work in it; besides the business is very profitable and it provides good profits.  She works from 9am until noon.

This is her second ODEF loan.  It’s 9,000 lempiras that will be used to buy foodstuffs like meat and other supplies like firewood, paper towels, etc. for food preparation.  Her goal is to support her daughter so that she can complete her schooling and also to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and supplies like firewood, paper towels, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca lidia tiene 51 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad el cual ya es una persona independiente, ella vive con un hermano y 2 sobrinos en el Municipio de Choloma Cortes.
Blanca es una mujer muy emprendedora hace 4 años estableció su taller propio de costura, elabora faldas, camisas sencillas y también hace muñecas con vestidos. Adquirió gran experiencia durante el trabajo que desempeño en una maquila. le dedica de 2.00 pm a 6.00 pm.
Ha obtenido 5 prestamos con ODEF, los que han invertido y ha logrado obtener buenas ganancias. Este préstamo actual es de 2,500 lempiras y lo utilizara para comprar materiales como telas, hilos broches, botones etc. 
Su plan es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca Lidia, 51, is a single mother; she has a 22 year old son who is already an independent person.  She lives with a brother and two nephews in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Blanca is a very enterprising woman.  Four years ago she set up her own sewing workshop.  She makes skirts, simple shirts and also dolls with dresses.  She acquired much experience during her employment at an assembly plant.  She works from 2pm until 6pm.

She’s gotten five ODEF loans that she’s invested and attained good profits with.  This current loan is for 2,500 lempiras that she’ll use to buy supplies like fabric, thread, clasps, buttons, etc.   Her plan is to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Heber Noe

texts.es:
Heber, de 24 años de edad, tiene dos años de casados, con un hijo de un año de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Victoria Yoro.
Heber, se dedica a realizar trabajos de carpintería desde hace 5 años. Elabora mesas, sillas, puertas y marcos, chineros etc. de madera no tradicional y de color, además compra y vende madera de color.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero como tiene la habilidad y experiencia en este oficio de carpintería, él quería experimentar con su propio taller, pues logro iniciar con fondos propios y luego solicito un préstamo, lo que le  ayudo a incrementar sus ventas. 
Actualmente está solicitando el segundo préstamo para comprar un motor para la cortadora de madera. Su idea es desarrollar más su negocio para obtener los ingresos que solventen sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Heber, 24, has been married for two years and has a one year old son; he lives in a village in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.

Heber has been doing carpentry work for five years.   He makes tables, chairs, doors, window frames, china cabinets, etc. out of non-traditional, colored woods.  He also buys and sells colored wood.  He used to work in agriculture but since he has experience and ability in carpentry he wanted to experiment with his own shop that he managed to start up with his own funds and then asked for a loan that helped him increase sales.

He’s currently asking for his second loan to buy a motor for his wood saw.  His idea is to develop the business more to obtain the income that will cover his needs.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his saw.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, con 26, 29 y 39 años de edad, y vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.
Doña Ingrid, en busca de tener una fuente de ingresos que le ayuden a suplir las necesidades del hogar, decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como granos básicos, harina, manteca, pastas, salsas, especies, lácteos etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 4 años y lo inicio con fondos propios y prestamos que le han ayudado a crecer en volumen de ventas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, atiende todo el día a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo con ODEF, para surtir de mas productos de toda clase de abarrotería, para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 53, is a single mother of thee children who are 26, 29 and 39 years old; she lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida.

Searching for a source of income that would help her cover household needs, Ingrid decided to set up a business of her own, a grocery store where she sells basic staple items like basic grains, flour, lard, pasta, sauces, spices, dairy products, etc.  She’s had the business for four years and started it with her own funds and loans that have helped her grow in sales volume.  She’s a very hardworking woman and tends to he customers every day.

She’s asking ODEF for a loan to stock her store with all kinds of grocery items to increase sales and have items customers request available.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic food staple items.

loans.name: Unificada 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA 2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de tejido y chompas, tienda de barrio, venta y tejido de mantas.

La señora Martha, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de refrescos y abarrotes) estos productos los comprará de las personas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The “UNIFICADA 2” Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Office. It is made up of six members and has a board headed by Sra. Martha. The businesses engaged in by bank members are varied and include selling food, selling woven goods and sweaters, a neighborhood store and selling woven blankets.

Sra Martha says that this is the first time she has joined a communal bank and that currently she has a business selling food. She has been working for years and learned the business from her mother. The loan in this cycle is for expansion of her merchandise (the purchase of soft drinks and groceries). She will buy these products from distributors and later market them in her retail space.. This type of work enables her to support her family since she is unmarried and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training workshops in the areas of health and credit.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Medio Ambiente Group

texts.es:
Doña Digna tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y reside en la Comunidad de los posos, en la ciudad de Juticalpa, en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 15 años trabaja vendiendo cosméticos. Su negocio lo inició por una amiga que se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos y empezó a trabajar en conjunto con ella, fue así como comenzó tomando experiencia, su forma de trabajo lo hace ambulante ya que sus clientes le hacen los pedidos por anticipado. El préstamo que solicita doña digna lo necesita para comprar mercadería nueva como ser: lociones, cremas, acondicionadores para el cabello, cremas faciales, entre otros productos. 
Una de las metas de doña Digna es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de forma honesta, ya que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles, sueña con ser una microempresaria de éxito y poder tener un local propio para la venta de su producto. La vida económica de doña Digna ha cambiado grandemente ya que tiene 15 años que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA, y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doña Digna is 55 years old, married and has 3 children.  Her husband makes his living in agriculture.  She lives in the Posos community of the city of Juticalpa, Olancho Department.  For the last 15 years, doña Digna has worked selling cosmetics.  A friend of hers, who made her living selling cosmetics, started the business, and doña Digna started working jointly with her.  That is how she started getting experience.  She travels around to sell her products, since her customers place orders.  Doña Digna needs the requested loan to purchase new merchandise, such as: lotions, creams, hair conditioners, facial creams and other products.
One of doña Digna's goals is to teach her children to make an honest living, as that is the best legacy she can leave them.  She hopes to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and to be able to have her own shop for selling her products.  Doña Digna's financial life has changed greatly, as she has been receiving support with FAMA loans for 15 years.  She has punctually complied with her re-payment schedules.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, conditioners and other items.

loans.name: Fanny Sanabria Rueda

texts.es: Fanny de 58 años, tiene dos hijos en las edades de 25 y 27 años;  en el año 1987 se retiró de una empresa de condimentos de la ciudad para responder a la atención y cuidado de sus hijos, desde ese momento empezó a comprar cosméticos y blusas, con las cuales hacia una rifa para lograr ingresos y apoyar el gasto familiar, mientras atendía su hogar. Gradualmente empezó a vender mercancía variada y su principal clientela, fueron sus antiguos compañeros de trabajo a quienes les acreditaba mercancía, para que se la pagaran en varias partidas; así fue como hizo su primera cartera de clientes, a los que fue agregando nuevos productos paso a paso como,  calzado para tener nuevas líneas de ventas; en el año 1990 se trasladó al municipio de Barrancas, le alquiló el horno a una tienda y trabajó por espacio de 7 años. Al regresar a la ciudad de Barranquilla construyó su propia casa,  compró una vitrina y con el dinero que le quedó,  compró mercancía con la que surtió su pequeño punto de ventas, gradualmente se fue vinculando a empresas que en su proveeduría, entregaban catálogos para la promoción y venta de sus productos, así mismo tiene otra actividad que también genera ingresos como es la preparación y venta de postres y hayacas. Con esta actividad ha logrado dar estudio a sus dos hijos y sueña con verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad su creciente clientela pide cada día mas productos y ante esto su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, ropa interior e insumos para la producción de hayacas y postres. Su experiencia en el trabajo, su dinamismo y su empeño en crecer, son hoy las razones de que su inversión de Kiva sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Fanny, 58, has two children who are 25 and 27 years old.  In 1987 she left work in a condiment firm in the city to take care of her children.  Since then she started buying cosmetics and blouses that she’d raffle off to earn income and help cover family expenses while tending to her home.  Gradually she started to sell assorted merchandise to her main clientele.  It was usually her former coworkers that she’d sell to on credit that they’d pay off in installments.  This is how she formed her first portfolio of customers.  She gradually added new products like shoes to have new sales lines.  In 1990 she settled in the town of Barrancas, leased an oven in a store and worked for 7 years.

When she returned to the city of Barranquilla she built her own house, bought a display case and with the money she had left over bought merchandise that she used to stock her small sales point.  She gradually became associated with firms that promote and sell products via catalogue.  She also has another income generating activity which is making and selling desserts and hayacas [type of tamal wrapped in banana leaves].  With this activity she’s managed to provide her two children with schooling and she dreams with seeing them become successful professionals.

Currently, her growing clientele is asking for more products every day and her working capital is insufficient to meet demand which is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy perfume, underwear and ingredients to make hayacas and desserts.  Her work experience, her dynamism and her determination to grow are today the reasons why her Kiva investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy perfume, underwear and ingredients to make hayacas and desserts.

loans.name: Luis Enrique Conrrado Pantaleon

texts.es: Luis  con su credikiva compró una máquina para cortar huesos, mucha carne y mejoró el techo del expendio. Él se encuentra muy satisfecho y tiene su negocio bien ubicado en el municipio y nuevos clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla a los que le vende a crédito; ahora esta aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para comprar en mayor volumen y responderle efectivamente a un nuevo mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva nuevamente, con el cual comprará carnero y cerdo en volumen y aumentar sus ganancias y así mismo su capital de trabajo. “Les agradezco que me apoyaran con un primer crédito, el cual me esmeré para pagarlo puntualmente. Espero continúen apoyando para sacar adelante mi negocio y mi familia.“
texts.en:
Luis used his Kiva loan to buy a machine to cut bones, lots of meat and improved the roof on his store.  He’s very satisfied and his business is well located in the town and he has new customers in the city of Barranquilla that he sells to on credit.

He’s now applying for a new Kiva loan to buy in larger amounts to effectively respond to a new market.  This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan again to buy veal and pork in volume to increase profits and working capital.

“Thank you for supporting me with the first loan which I strove to pay off on time.  I hope you will continue supporting me in order to move my business and my family ahead.”

loans.use: to buy veal and pork.

loans.name: Maira Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Maira, es una señora muy activa y alegre, ella  una emprendedora y se dedica a la venta de Jugos Naturales, Refrescos, Churros y otros productos de consumo diario en su casa de habitación en la aldea la cuesta, en donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, familiares, amigos.
Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años en donde a demostrado crecimiento y quien mantiene su clientela por sus años de antigüedad en el negocio.
Doña Maira esta solicitando a PRISMA de Honduras la cantidad de 7,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en su negocio y compra mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su sueño principal es salir adelante con su familia y darles una mejor vida.



San Lorenzo, Honduras – Febrero 2012
texts.en:
Maira is a very energetic and happy woman.  She is enterprising and works selling natural juices, soft drinks, churros and other products for daily consumption from her home in the village of La Cuesta.  Her principal customers are her neighbors, family members and friends.  
She has worked at this activity for several years, and has shown an ability to grow and maintain her clientele due to the length of time she has been in business.  Maira is requesting a loan from PRISMA Honduras of 7,000.00 lempiras to invest in her business and buy more products to offer her customers.
Her main dream is to get ahead with her family and give them a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drink, sugar and other products for her business.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es:
El joven Wilson tiene 21 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, dedicado a su negocio actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, junto con el vive su esposa que también es comerciante, Wilson comparte con su esposa las responsabilidades en el hogar, el vive en la ciudad de Choluteca. Wilson vende sus productos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad como Monjaras, San Lorenzo, San Marcos, El Espino y diferentes barrios y colonia de esta ciudad donde reside, ya que tiene muchos clientes los cuales le hacen pedidos todas las semanas. El crédito que se le otorgo lo utilizo para la compra de controles de TV, fajas, carteras, relojes, focos, calculadoras, radios etc. el impacto que tuvo el financiamiento en su actividad es que ahora tiene una buena variedad de producto y así de esta manera sus ventas han crecido ya que puede satisfacer cada los pedidos que le hace sus clientes y atraer nuevos clientes. Los planes a futuro es comprar un carro para así poder llegara a muchos mas lugares en otras localidades.  



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 21-year-old young man and very much a fighter, a person dedicated to his business, a job he has done for four years.  He lives with his wife, who is also a merchant.  Wilson shares the household responsibilities with his wife.  He lives in the city of Choluteca.

Wilson sells his products in different places in the city, such as Monjaras, San Lorenzo, San Marcos, El Espino, and different neighborhoods and communities of this city where he lives, because he has many customers who make requests every week.

He used the loan he was granted to buy television remote controls, belts, wallets, watches, flashlights, calculators, radios, etc.

The impact of the loan on his job is that now he has a good variety of products and in this way his sales have grown because he is able to satisfy all the requests his customers make of him and attract new customers.  His plan for the future is to buy a car so he will be able to get to many more places in other towns.

Choluteca, Honduras--March 2012.

loans.use: to buy belts, radios, remote controls, flashlights, calculators, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Karina Sofia De La Hoz Zarate

texts.es: Karina de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su única hija de 21 años de edad. Sus habilidades administrativas no se derivan de estudios especiales, sino de su aptitud para hacerlo y de su experiencia, pues durante muchos años administró negocios de un amigo, mientras este vivía en el exterior del país. Aprovechando su potencial emprendedor natural, logró ahorrar y compró una ferretería que ya tenía 3 años en el sector, pero que se había estancado, con su olfato de negocio, logró organizarla y hacerla producir, apoyada por su hija, que estudia parte del tiempo y la otra parte la dedica a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para construcción, pues es lo que mas consumen sus clientes y ella quiere responderles oportunamente, pues es un negocio muy bien ubicado y necesita acreditarse en toda la comunidad. El potencial exitoso de esta inversión es que con ella logra dar una respuesta efectiva a sus clientes, en un momento en el que muchos negocios no lo hacen. Así mismo el olfato de negocio de Karina muy seguramente la llevaran por el camino del progreso en compañía de su única hija que es su apoyo incondicional
texts.en:
Karina, 46, lives in the town of Malambo, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with her only daughter, 21.  Her administrative abilities do not come from her particular studies but from her aptitude for them and from her experience, because during many years she managed the business of a friend while he was abroad.

Taking advantage of her natural entrepreneurial potential, she managed to save and bought a hardware store that already had been in the area for three years but that had become stagnant.  With her instinct for business, she managed to organize it and make it produce, helped by her daughter, who studies part of the time and works in her business the rest of the time.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy construction materials because it is what her customers buy most.  She wants to meet their demand promptly because it is a very well located business and she needs to prove herself to the whole community.

The potential for success of this investment is that, with it, she will manage to give an effective response to her customers at a time in which many businesses do not do this.  Also, Karina's instinct for business certainly will take her on the road to progress in the company of her only daughter, who is her unconditional support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Faed

texts.en:
Faed is a 33-year-old married man living in Sana'a. He is characterized as being very hardworking and he always wants to offer his family a good quality of life. Faed is the father of two children who are his motivation for making an effort in his work every day. He worked in his friend's salon as a barber for a couple of years in order to feed his family. Then he started his independent business a year ago and called two of his friends to work with him. 

Faed makes enough income to cover the costs of his home. Due to the good quality of his products and the good service that he offers, he has a large number of customers to the point that he currently cannot satisfy all the demand for his business. With the intention of satisfying all of his customers, Faed is looking for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to purchase more chairs, mirrors and shaving cream, enabling him to meet all of the demand for his business.

Faed hopes to expand his business and attract new clients. He also hopes to open another salon on another street and make it possible for other free young people to work.

loans.use: to purchase more chairs, mirrors and shaving cream

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 42-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Fedaa has a homebased project selling clothes.

Fedaa is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 35-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Ghada has a shop where she sells cosmetic products. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more cosmetics for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 42-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Abeer is a tailor with a home-based workshop. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase fabrics and thread for her business.

Abeer is looking to have her own workshop away from her home with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread

loans.name: Zikrullo

texts.ru: Зикрулло проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Zikrullo lives in the city of Dangara.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  Zikrullo has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru: Отабек 1981 года рождения,он женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Отабек живет с родителями.Он вмести с отцом занимается разведением скота.Когда Отабек был еще мальчиком, отец научил его этому ремеслу,.
