У них есть козы, которых они стригут,  а шерсть после обработки выставляют на продажу. Посоветовавшись с отцом,он только потом решил получить у нас кредит. Кредит ему необходим для увеличение поголовья скота, в дальнейшем скот будет разводить легче, так как появиться трава и другие кормовые культуры.
texts.en: Otabek was born 1981.  He is married and has one child.  Otabek lives with his parents.  Together with his father, he is involved in breeding livestock.  When Otabek was still a boy, his father taught him this trade.  They have goats, which they shear and sell the fur after processing it.  After seeking advice form his father, he only then decided to obtain a loan from us.  Otabek needs the loan to increase his livestock headcount.  In the future, it would be easier to breed livestock because there will be grass and other feed crops.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Santa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santa, es una persona emprendedora, responsable ella vive en una comunidad en el sur de Honduras, ella se dedica a la venta de leña, negocio que ha tenido desde hace varios años en el cual atiende a todos sus familiares, vecinos y amigos que hacen uso de su producto día con día. Doña Santa esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en compra de leña para atender a sus clientes con mejor y mas producto.
Doña Santa esta solicitando a PRISMA de Honduras la cantidad de 7,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en su negocio a un plazo de 8 meses.
Su sueño principal es sacar a su familia adelante para tener mejores condiciones de vida.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Febrero 2012
texts.en:
Santa is an enterprising, responsible person.  She lives in a community in southern Honduras.  She sells firewood for a living and she has had this business for several years now.  She serves all of her family members, neighbors, and friends, who use her product every day.  Santa is asking for a loan to buy firewood to better serve her customers with more product.  

Santa is asking Prisma Honduras for the amount of 7,000 lempiras to invest in her business for an eight-month term.

Her main dream is to get her family ahead to have better living conditions.

San Lorenza, Honduras -- February 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood for her business

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу 63 года, вдова, воспитала 9 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жумабубу  в 1997 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Жумабубу, ее поголовье насчитывает  5 дойных коров и 35 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Жумабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы в будущем открыть свою миниферму.
texts.en: Jumabubu is 63 years old, a widow and raised nine children.  To provide a source of income for her family, Jumabubu became involved in animal husbandry in 1997.  The business, started with 10,000 som (KGS), today yields about 12,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and meat products.  Thanks to Jumabubu's hard work, her livestock headcount includes five dairy cows and thirty-five sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Jumabubu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount in order to open her own mini-farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Arina

texts.ru: Арина очень активная и умная женщина, она очень любит свою дочь и внука. Она живет одна, дочь находиться в другом городе со своим мужем и сыном, но время от времени приезжает навещать Арину.  Раньше Арина заведовала магазином, со временем  она начала реализовать свой товар. Теперь у нее большой ассортимента товара. Она оптом торгует приправами и другими продуктами питания. С нашей организацией сотрудничает с 2007 года. На рынке работает около 6 лет. Арина очень благодарна Арванд, она рада что существуют такие организации которые могут ее поддерживать.
texts.en: Arina is a very active and smart woman.  She loves her daughter and grandson very much.  She lives alone.  Her daughter is another city with her husband and son, but comes to visit Arina from time to time.  Previously, Arina managed a store and with time started to sells her own merchandise.  Now, she has a large assortment of goods.  She sells spices and other food products wholesale.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2007.  She has been working at the market for about six years.  Arina is very grateful to Arvand and happy that such organizations that can support her exist.

loans.use: to expand a selection of goods

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Истаравшан. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Хасан занимается купле – продажей одежды. В этой области она десять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Hasan is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 35 years old, married and has two children.  Hasan is involved in buying and selling clothing.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to buy seasonal merchandise in order to expand the selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле- продажей детской и подростковой  одежды, а также обуви. Она в этой сфере бизнесе уже более 21 лет и имеет богатый опыт. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки летней обуви с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Matluba is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is married and a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling children's and teenage clothing and also shoes.  Matluba has been in this business for over 21 years and a rich experience in it.  She wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy summer shoes in order to expand her business.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy summer shoes

loans.name: Kyzjibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек 63 года, вдова, воспитала 6 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Кызжибек  в 1991 году начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с покупки одной овцематки хозяйство  на сегодня насчитывает  1 дойную корову и 10 овец. Также Кызжибек обрабатывает 3,2 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кызжибек обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кызжибек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы в будущем расширить бизнес – деятельность за счет открытия магазина продуктов.
texts.en: Kyzjibek is 63 years old, a widow and raised six children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1991.  The sheep business, started with a purchase of one ewe, today contains one dairy cow and ten sheep.  Kyzjibek also works on 3.2 hectares of land, where she grows beans and wheat.  In order to further develop her business, Kyzjibek requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount, so that she could further expand her business in the future by opening a food store.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.ru: Шарифахон трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина, которая замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Её муж занимается производством тандыров. Более 16 лет Шарифахон занимается купле- продажей обуви и детской одежды. Её торговая точка находится в центре города. Шарифахон хотела бы получить займ для покупки сезонной одежды. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Sharifakhon is a hardworking and conscientious woman, who is married and a loving mother of four children.  Her husband is involved in manufacturing of tandoor ovens.  Sharifakhon has been involved in buying and selling shoes and children's clothing for over 16 years.  Her retail outlet is located in the city center.  Sharifakhon wants to obtain this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Aneta needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to expand the business.

Aneta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Aneta's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise bananas

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting cocoa for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lusila needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to continue improving her land.

In 2011, Lusila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lusila's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing cocoa

loans.name: Julia De La Rosa Montaño

texts.es: Julia de 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante pedidos.  Julia es una mujer casada y tienen un hijo de 22 años de edad, con el cual sueña verlo convertido en una persona exitosa. Desde hace 3 años ahorró de la mesada que le suministra su hijo y emprendió sus propias aventuras de negocio, pues necesitaba sentirse productiva y apoyar la económica de su hogar. Así fue como empezó a comprar sobrecamas, toallas, que vendió a crédito inicialmente entre familiares y amigos, con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, pero tiene muchos deseos de crecer y su mayor desafío para lograrlo es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar y ampliar su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará edredones, toallas, sandalias, que han sido solicitadas por sus clientes, lo cual hace que esta inversión se potencialice como exitosa.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla, where she makes a living selling goods through customer orders. She is married and has a 22 year old son who she hopes will become a successful person. 

Three years ago she saved enough from the stand that her son supplies and started her own business adventure because she needed to feel productive and to financially support her home. This was how she began to purchase bed quilts and towels which she initially sold on credit to friends and relatives. 

Julia has done very well with her business but she hopes for it to grow. The biggest challenge to expanding her business is having enough capital for purchasing and broadening her customer base. This is why she is asking for a loan, which is the first funding that she is requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase quilts, towels, and sandals that her customers have asked for, and thus her investment will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, towels, and sandals.

loans.name: Julio Cesar Camacho Meza

texts.es: Julio de 40 años de edad  es un hombre casado y padre de 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 11 años de edad, que vive al sur de la ciudad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de suero y crema de leche, la cual vende al por mayor y al detal. Desde el departamento del Magdalena le viene la materia prima para su trabajo, que es la masa que el licua, mezcla y envasa, en recipientes plásticos hasta de un litro para el suero y de una libra para la crema de leche.  Sus principales clientes, son vecinos, amigos e intermediarios, como tiendas, vendedores ambulantes y panaderías,  que se acercan diariamente a realizar su compra al por mayor y al detal y con el dinero en la mano, como lo hace la gran mayoría de clientes. Su mayor fortaleza es el manejo de precios alcanzables para sus compradores y la calidad de sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla con su cuñada quien es su socia y ambos tienen muchos sueños de crecimiento empresarial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, masa de suero, para incrementar la producción y la venta de sus dos productos estrellas: El suero y la crema de leche. Su meta es lograr un mayor volumen de sus ventas a crédito y en mayor volumen para aumentar sus clientela y con ello las utilidades del negocio, que lo ayudan a aumentar el bienestar de su familia..
texts.en: Forty-year-old Julio is a married man and the father of two children who are nine and eleven years old.  He lives in the southern part of the city and he makes and sells whey and whey cream for a living, which he sells wholesale and retail.  The raw material for his work comes from the department of Magdalena.  This is the mixture he liquefies, mixes, and bottles in one-liter plastic containers for the whey and one-pound plastic containers for the whey cream.  His main customers are his neighbors, friends, and middlemen, such as stores, street vendors, and bakeries, who come by daily to make their wholesale and retail purchases with money in hand, as the vast majority of his customers do.  His greatest strength is his ability to maintain prices that are affordable for his buyers and the quality of his products.  He works in his business with his sister-in-law, who is his partner, and they both have many dreams of growing their business.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy whey starter to increase production and sales of his two star products, whey and whey cream.  His goal is to have higher sales on credit and to sell in greater quantities to increase his clientele and, with that, to increase his business's profits, which help him improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy whey starter wholesale and in cash

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taamu (giant taro) for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Beauty needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Beauty joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Beauty's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Moli

texts.en:
Moli is 20 years old and married with 2 children. She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Moli needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Moli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Moli's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers to start a vegetable garden

loans.name: Sonadores Con Proposito 6 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group "Soñadores con Proposito" (Dreamer with a purpose) 6. This group is located in the city of El Seybo, one of the most agricultural and rural cities in the Dominican Republic. The borrowers run their businesses in the communities near the city. They sell clothes, shoes, grocery store items and others.

Margarita makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and four children. She is a devoted mother. She is running a clothing store where she sells all kinds of men's, kid's and women's clothes. She will use this loan to increase her inventory by buying more clothes, specially for the summer season. She is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business and she uses the profits to reinvest in her business and to save. Her future plan is to expand her clothing store with more products like cosmetics and accessories. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Wendy tiene 31 años de edad y vive al sur de la ciudad con sus tres hijos, en las edades de 5 a 13 años. Su idea de negocio nació desde que terminó su bachillerato y estudió en una academia para ser estilista de belleza, su experiencia la recibió trabajando para una peluquería durante 10 años, donde desarrolló todas sus habilidades, para finalmente dedicarse a este oficio, desde la casa paterna donde habita con sus hijos. Su meta es tener varias peluquerías abiertas en diversos sitios de la ciudad, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío para lograrlo. En su negocio tiene una clientela que la reconoce en sus capacidades técnicas y porque es una persona con vocación de servicio, por eso aunque la competencia es otro de sus desafíos, la enfrenta con buenos precios a sus clientes y ofreciéndoles como servicio el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará insumos de peluquería,  como productos capilares y de aseo personal, que también están abriéndose paso en su mercado de clientes, siempre que ella los asesora y es por esto que los vende también, desde su salón de belleza y esto es justamente la razón del éxito que muy probablemente tendrá su inversión .
texts.en: Wendy is 31 years old and she lives in the southern part of the city with her three children, who range from five to thirteen years old.  Her idea for her business came about when she graduated from high school and she attended a cosmetology academy.  She gained her experience working in a hair salon for ten years, where she developed all of her abilities so that she could finally dedicate herself to this profession working out of her parents' home, where she lives with her children.  Her goal is to have several hair salons open in different areas of the city, but her working capital is her biggest challenge to achieving it.  The clientele she has at her business recognizes her technical abilities and, because she is a person with a vocation for service, she faces the challenge of competition with good prices for her customers and by offering them the service of improving their personal and professional images.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy hair salon supplies, such as hair products and beauty products, which are also becoming more popular with her customers, as she gives them consultations.  That is why she sells them in her beauty salon as well and this is the exact reason her investment will probably be successful.

loans.use: to buy hair salon supplies, such as hair products and beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 27 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio de artículos decorativos en madera Country. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se independizó de su familia a muy temprana edad, arrendó un apartamento y se fue a vivir sola; inicialmente trabajaba  como profesora de un jardín y hacia refuerzos a niños que tenían problemas de aprendizaje o requerían les apoyara  en dar respuesta a sus tareas  educativas. Una vez se interesó en aprender el oficio artesanal de decoración en madera,  dio rienda suelta a su creatividad y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios y desde entonces decora todo lo que, portarretratos, llaveros etc. Su clientela está conformada por familiares, vecinos y amigos, y también personas que estos le han referenciado. Hace mas de un año se dedica a la decoración de madera y esta se le ha convertido en una actividad que le apasiona y la disfruta,  mientras con ella  genera sus propios  ingresos. En sus sueños de crecimiento, está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará cuadros de madera, portarretratos, cofres, llaveros, pintura y recinas, para aplicarle su tecina de decoración, de la cual se siente orgullosa y la hace sentir libre
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old and sells decorative wooden products. She is a young entrepreneur who became independent from her family at a very young age when she rented an apartment and went to live alone. At first she worked as a preschool teacher and helped children with learning disabilities and those who needed help with their schoolwork. 

Once she became interested in learning the art of wooden decorations, she found an outlet for her creativity and started her own business adventure. Since then she decorates everything from picture frames to key chains, etc. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends, as well as people who have been referred to her. 

Maria has been decorating wooden products for more than a year. This activity has become her passion and something that she enjoys, and with it she earns her income. In the hopes of growing her business, Maria is requesting this loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase wooden boxes, picture frames, boxes, key chains, paint, and resins. She will apply her touch of decoration, which makes her feel proud and free.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boxes, picture frames, boxes, key chains, paint, and resins.

loans.name: Puna

texts.en:
Puna is 36 years old and married with five children. She is starting a business venture, growing and harvesting a variety of crops for sale. Puna needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to continue improving her land.

In 2012, Puna joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Puna's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome, to help her crops grow.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет в Дрогобыче. Она торгует носками, колготками, перчатками, боксерками и тапками на одном из местных рынков. Ее торговая точка расположена в проходе на рынок, где проходит весь поток потенциальных клиентов. Этим видом предпринимательской деятельности Надежда занимается уже 12 лет. Товара у нее на данный момент – на сумму в 10 000 гривен. 

На данный момент бизнес Надежды не особенно развит, но, тем не менее, дает стабильную прибыль для нее и ее семьи. Надежда надеется использовать кредит для того, чтобы увеличить количество весеннего ассортимента товара. Более разнообразный выбор товара привлечет клиентов, и Надежда сможет заработать больше за счет более быстрого товарооборота. Мелочи и недорогие товары, которые реализует Надежда, хорошо продаются и пользуются широким спросом. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Nadezhda lives in Drogobych.  She sells socks, stockings, gloves, tank tops and slippers at one of the local markets.  Her retail outlet is located at the walkway to the market, where all of the potential clients pass through.  Nadezhda has been involved in this entrepreneurship for 12 years.  She currently has merchandise valued at 10,000 hryvnia.  Currently, Nadezhda's business is not very developed, but despite that, it provides a stable income for her and her family.  Nadezhda hopes to use the loan to expand the inventory of spring merchandise selection.  A more varied choice of merchandise attracts customers, and Nadezhda would be able to earn more due to a quicker goods turnover.  Small things and inexpensive goods that Nadezhda sells sell well and are in high demand.

loans.use: to expand the inventory of spring merchandise

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Более 6 лет Мухарам занимается купле- продажей обуви и детской одежды. Она замужняя женщина и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Мухарам имеет богатый опыт, а также много постоянных клиентов. Её торговая точка находится на центральном рынке. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы немножко улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки товара на предстоящий сезон. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: For more then 6 years Muharam has been selling shoes and children's clothes on the local market. She is a married woman and is raising three children. Muharam has a lot of experience in sales and has many regular clients. Her market stall is located at the central city market. She wants to expand her business so that she can improve her family's living conditions a little. With this goal in mind Muharam has requested a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase merchandise for the upcoming spring season. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a merchandise

loans.name: Rajamo

texts.ru: Рачамо занимается производством хлопкового масла. В этой области она пять лет. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Рачамо берет кредит для покупки семян хлопчатника.
texts.en: Rajamo produces cotton seed oil. She has had her oil pressing business for five years. Rajamo is 58 years old, married and a mother of six children. She is taking out this loan to purchase cotton seeds in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds

loans.name: Utuie

texts.en:
Utuie is 42 years old and married with two children. She is starting a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Utuie needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or about US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Utuie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Utuie's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина с мужем и сыном-подростком живет в Каменке. Она занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в тепличных условиях для последующей их реализации на рынках города. Ирина имеет большой участок земли. У нее есть три большие теплицы, а также две теплицы для рассады. Выращиванием овощей она занимается уже 3 года. В хозяйство вложено около 150 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 27 000 гривен. 

Ирина планирует вложить полученные от КИВА заемные средства в установку отопительной системы в своих теплицах. Для того, чтобы закупить необходимые шланги, насосы и крепления потребуется сумма в 12 000 гривен. Недавно Ирина купила котел за 18 000 гривен, теперь необходимо приобрести все остальные детали и провести отопление во всех теплицах, что она планировала сделать уже давно. В этом году Ирина вложила все имеющиеся у нее средства в отопление, а в следующем надеется сделать ремонт в доме. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Irina lives with her husband and son in the city of Kamenka. She grows early vegetables in greenhouses for sale at city markets. Irina owns a large plot of land and has been farming for three years. She has three big greenhouses and also two greenhouses for seedlings. Her farm is worth 150,000 griven now and she spends 27,000 griven yearly to purchase seeds and plastic foil.

Irina is planning to use the loan from Kiva to install a heating system in her greenhouses. She needs 12,000 griven so that she can buy the necessary pumps, tubing and holders. Recently Irina used 18,000 griven to purchase a water heater and now she needs this loan to purchase the rest of the supplies and install the heating systems in her greenhouses as she has been planning to do for a long time. This year Irina has invested all of her money into this project but in the future she is hoping to use some of the profits to repair her family home.

loans.use: to install heating system in greenhouses

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с женой и двумя взрослыми детьми живет в селе Благовещенка. Он уже 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивая ранние овощи в тепличных условиях на продажу. Александр владеет большим участком земли, на которых он поставил уже 3 теплицы, а также одну под рассаду. В хозяйство у него вложено 40 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют около 21 000 гривен. 

Александр планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 15 000 гривен в подготовку к новому фермерскому сезону: он сможет закупить пленку на 7 000 гривен, семена на 5 000 гривен и навоз в качестве удобрений на 3 000 гривен. Александр делает ставку на развитие, хочет со временем сделать полный ремонт в доме, который они не так давно приобрели.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander, his wife and their two adult children live in the village of Blagoveschenka. Alexander has been farming for 20 years, he grows early vegetables for the city markets. He owns a large plot of land where he has three greenhouses, as well as a small greenhouse for seedlings. He has invested 40,000 griven into his farm and he spends 21,000 griven yearly for seeds and plastic foil.

Alexander is planning to use the 15,000 griven KIVA loan to get ready for the farming season: he will be able to buy plastic foil for 7,000 griven, seeds for 5,000 griven and manure for fertilizing for 3,000 griven. Alexander is planning to develop his business in the future since he needs more profits in order to repair his newly purchased house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and plastic foil

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es: Emperatriz  de 43 años, se dedica a la venta de queso y carne de res en el municipio de Soledad,  a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos,  en las edades de 11 a 23 años.  En el año 1987 se inició vendiéndole queso a una tienda en el municipio de San Antonio, y con lo bien que le fue, generó sus propios ingresos.  Por eso cuando su familia se trasladó a la ciudad de Barranquilla en el año 1992, inició esta misma actividad entre sus vecinos, y fue construyendo su clientela con tiendas y negocios de alimentos, que aun le compran. Últimamente ha incorporado a su negocio carne de res y con este negocio tiene un nuevo mercado, construido desde la clientela que le compra el queso, que trae desde el departamento del Magdalena. Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia, por eso todos los días trabaja para   lograrlo. Su negocio ha crecido y su potencial de clientes también, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará queso y carne en mayor cantidad, con ello el volumen de ventas se incrementará y así mismo sus utilidades; su proyecto de inversión se visiona como exitoso,  porque está basado no solo en su experiencia,  sino también en una clientela que desde ya,  ha hecho sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 43 years old and sells cheese and beef in the community of Soledad, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. She lives there with her husband and three children ages 11 to 23. 

In 1987 Emperatriz began to sell cheese to a store in the community of San Antonio and it went so well that she generated her own income. Because of this, when her family moved to Barranquilla in 1992, she began this same activity among her neighbors. Over time she built her customer base with stores and grocers that still buy from her today. 

Recently Emperatriz has been incorporating beef into her business. This has opened to her a new market based on the customers that purchase cheese from her, which she brings from the region of Magdalena. Her dream is to acquire her own dwelling and she works every day to achieve this. 

Her business and potential for customers have grown so Emperatriz is requesting this loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will purchase cheese and meat in bulk, which will increase her volume of sales and thus increase her profits. She envisions her investment project as successful because it is based not only on her experience, but also on a customer base that as of now has already made requests.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and meat in bulk.

loans.name: Tania Guillen Guerra

texts.es: Tania de 41 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 a 16 años. Ella es una ama de casa que trabajó varios años en una casa de eventos y al retirarse decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios,  comercializando cuadros y adornos en madera,  que le envían desde Medellín, sus productos los vende a crédito para recibir pagos en un plazo de 2  a 3 meses. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédkiva,  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías, entre cuadros y adornos de maderas, para responder a sus pedidos, pues últimamente su clientela se ha incrementado y responder a ellos se convierte en todo un desafío. Su mercado está ubicado en el estrato socioeconómico medio, pues los productos se consideran suntuosos, pero gustan mucho entre los clientes que tienen la capacidad de compra. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y a futuro abrir un local al público. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 40% y una rotación de inventarios no mayor a 10  días.
texts.en: Forty-one-year-old Tania lives in the city of Baranquilla with her husband and her two children, who are 12 and 16 years old.  She is a housewife who worked at an event hall for several years and when she left she decided to start her own business venture selling paintings and wooden decorative pieces.  She receives her products from Medellín and sells them on credit, receiving payments over periods of two or three months.  She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy merchandise such as paintings and wooden decorative pieces to fill her orders, as lately her clientele has increased and keeping up has become a challenge.  Her market is in the mid-socioeconomic strata, as her products are considered to be luxuries, but they are very popular among the customers who can afford them.  Her goal is to keep expanding her business and, in the future, to open a space to the public.  While working towards this, she has maintains a profit margin of no less than 40% and an inventory turnover of no more than 10 days.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as paintings and wooden decorative pieces

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en:
Taliilagi is 27 years old and married with two children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Taliilagi needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 tala per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Taliilagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taliilagi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 21 years old and married with three children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Elisabeth needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or about US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Elisabeth joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Elisabeth's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Faataualofa

texts.en:
Faataualofa is 32 years old and married with three children. She plants and harvests bananas for sale. She has two years of experience in this business.    Faataualofa needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faataualofa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faataualofa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment to grow bananas.

loans.name: Sape

texts.en:
Sape is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.   

Sape needs a loan of 1,500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas or about US $146 per week) to continue improving the business.

In 2011, Sape joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sape's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора честная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж находится в трудовой миграции  в  Российской Федерации. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды. Она торгует на центральном рынке. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. Гулнора хотела бы получить займ для приобретения летней одежды. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и великодушие.
texts.en: Gulnora is an honest and kind woman. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Gulnora's husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She herself sells men's clothes and has been managing her central market stall for five years. When she started, Gulnora used to sell children clothes. She would like to take out a loan to purchase summer clothes for sale. Gulnora hopes for your support and charity.

loans.use: To buy new clothing

loans.name: Asunción  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Asunción está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, siendo la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es reconocida como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una  variada gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Nuestras socias son personas amables y gentiles, quienes laboran día a día en sus diferentes ocupaciones las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Ana, tiene de 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá labora en un taller de carpintería de su propiedad en el cual fabrican toda clase de muebles, puertas y ventanas, y su mamá es empleada privada. La casa en la que vive de propiedad de sus padres.

La Señorita. Ana labora en el negocio de su padre, actividad que ha iniciado a desempeñar hace 6 meses, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en madera para el negocio de su padre. 

Su meta es agrandar el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
The Asunción Communal Bank is made up of five female members and two male members who live in different areas of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the capital of the province of Azuay and it is the third most important city in the country.  It has been recognized as a World Heritage Site since December 1999.  It has a varied gastronomy and its people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Our members are nice and kind people who work day after day at their different occupations, which allow them to cover their household expenses and offer their children a better future.

One of the group's members is Ana.  She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad works in a carpenter's workshop that he owns, where he makes all kinds of furniture, doors, and windows, and her mom is a private employee.  The house she lives in belongs to her parents.

Ana works at her father's business, which she has done for six months now.  She works from Monday to Saturday without a set schedule.

This is her second loan with her communal bank and she will use it to buy wood for her father's business.

Her goal is to expand the family business.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Maatane

texts.en:
Maatane is thirty-one years old and single with four children. She runs a small business, making and selling handicrafts to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Maatane requested a loan to purchase materials needed to make her handicrafts. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family and continue improving her business. 

Maatane joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en:
Loimata is fifty-nine years old and married with two children. She runs a small business venture, making and selling a variety of snacks and food products. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Loimata requested a loan to purchase ingredients required to make the snacks and goods for sale. She will use the profits to support her family and continue improving her business.

Loimata joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make products to sell.

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merenciana is from Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is sixty-one years old. Merenciana is married and has three children. To make a living, Merenciana raises crops, planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Merenciana has been in her business for eleven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Merenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merenciana is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is a married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is responsible for a small young kid who completely depends on her care. Soeurn is involved in agribusiness during the rainy season but she also acts as a chef serving foods for a large group of people, particularly the ones who come for special ceremonies like wedding parties, birthday parties as well as funeral ceremonies. She has her own team to provide this type of service around the province or distant areas outside the province.  Another main source of income is from her husband who works at the construction field. He’s a construction foreman who leads a small group of men to perform particular jobs.

Presently, her family is experiencing difficulties in daily activities and businesses due to the lack of a proper vehicle for traveling. For this reason, Soeurn would like to acquire a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase a used motorcycle to provide good transportation for the entire family. Soeurn hopes to provide her family happiness and a comfortable situation through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to provide good transportation for the entire family.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy, age thirty-two, is a humble villager who lives with her spouse and three school-age children in Kompot province, Cambodia. Koy really enjoys her life being an honest rice cultivator there. She said that it’s the only business from which the family can generate a daily living. She prefers growing rice to other crops because rice produces a good result and helps the family to meet its daily needs. She is not concerned about operating this kind of business since her spouse is very supportive and works beside her. 

As of now, Koy is taking out for a loan from HKL and Kiva to rebuild a nice kitchen and build a toilet to ensure a healthier family. She has planed to do it for a few years, and now she can make this plan reality through the valued loan from our kind lenders.

loans.use: to rebuild a nice kitchen and build a toilet to ensure a healthier family.

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
Simoneides is from Centro Napo Tudela, Misamis Occodental. She is thirty-three years old and single. To make a living, Simoneides owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a parlor. 

Simoneides has been engaged in her business for twelve years and earns  8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Simoneides joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simoneides is requesting a loan of 16,600 PHP which will be used to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, etc for her parlor. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shampoo and other products for her parlor.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is from Sebasi Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is forty-nine years old. Ricardo is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Ricardo operates a motorcycle transport service. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for eleven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle so it can give a better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle so it can give better service.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business where she sells items like canned goods, rice, noodles and spices. Aurea is able to contribute to her family's earnings with her income from the store.

Aurea is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy two sacks of rice and canned goods to sell. This loan will help increase Aurea's profitability. Aurea hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Plan

texts.en:
Plan is a loving mother who is responsible for, and looks after, four children. They live in Baray district of Siem Reap province.

To pursue a standard of living and provide her children with a good education, Plan operates a fish selling business in a local market of the province. She sells various kinds of fish including fresh fish, dry fish, smoked fish and paste-fermented fish, earning approximately USD 3.50 per day. Plan’s husband is a supporter of this business. He normally catches fish from the river for Plan every day.

With the requested amount of USD 1,500, Plan will buy construction supplies so that she can finish the building works on her present house. She has already hired local skilled people to do the construction. This is her second loan cycle loan from our firm, HKL. She is confident she will pay her loan back to our funders as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to finish the construction work on her house.

loans.name: Preas

texts.en:
Preas is a nineteen-year-old married woman who resides in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She, together with her husband, earns a living in a fair way by dedicating their time to rice husbandry. She has been in this business since 2005. She has now become a young mother of two children. 

At present, Preas is seeking a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to supplement her savings so that she can build a suitable house to live in independently. It’ll be a great support to Preas to help her attain her dream of having a nice comfortable house in the province. 

In the future, Preas wants to buy extra farmland to expand her farming productivity in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to build a suitable house to live in independently.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is a married woman and has three children attending public state school. She lives with her husband and the children in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. Leng has spent most of her life cultivating crops for a livelihood. She grows rice, potatoes and vegetables on her own farm depending on the season of the year. She always has her children assist her in the maintenance at the rice field when they are free from school. Her husband shares his responsibility for the family by working as a soldier for government, receiving his payment monthly.

Now Leng decided to ask for her first loan, a sum of USD 500, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to better her living situation and avoid having to take motor-taxi services. Leng intends to save money to develop her agribusiness in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to better her living situation and avoid having to take motor-taxi services.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a forty-nine-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two children aged seventeen and twenty-one. Delia and her husband are both farmers. They cultivate their land to grow rice crops to sell. Delia's husband mainly manages their farm. Delia, on the other hand, does her best to contribute to her family's earnings. She runs a sari-sari store business located just at the front of their house. She sells various items like sugar, coffee, canned goods and toiletries.

Delia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. This will help increase Delia's business profitability. Delia plans to use her extra income to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Te

texts.en:
Te, thirty-three, lives in Dongkor commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city, with her life partner and two school-age school. Te owns small store selling many types of products to local people around her neighborhood. She sells sweet things, snacks, groceries and household materials as well. She typically generates in the neighborhood of USD 6.00 per day through this business activity.

Te has come to HKL for the second time to borrow some funds to purchase a stock of merchandise to sustain her business and make it stable. Without any funds from our lenders, Te will experience financial difficulties and won’t be able to continually run her business well.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married. Marcelina is forty-nine years old, residing in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products such as vegetables, snack items etc to earn a living. She's been eight years in this business, and each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more vegetables and snack items to sell. 

In 2008, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marcelina wants to make business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and snack items to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a fifty-five-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. Ernesto has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business. He earns 5,000 PHP per month with this business. Ernesto works hard to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school. 

He requested a loan to purchase more gasoline and spare parts. Ernesto hopes to expand his business and purchase an additional motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married with two children. She is twenty-eight years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Elvina owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Elvina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for four years. In the future, Elvina's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Felipa earns a living through running a sari-sari store business. She sells various items like canned goods, toiletries and soft drinks. She also sells gasoline and coconut wine. Felipa is happy to contribute to her family's earnings. She does her best to support her family: her husband and eight children. Felipa's husband is a farmer and she helps him sells his produce at the market.

Felipa is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and gasoline. Felipa hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and gasoline.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is seventy years old. Bonifacia is widow and has four children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a business venture selling barbequed food. Bonifacia has been in her business for four years and earns 4,300 PHP a month for these activities. Bonifacia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more chicken, hot dogs and other products to sell. 

In 2007, Bonifacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.en:
Wenceslao is sixty-four years old, a widower with three children. He is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his rice production is located. He was just twenty-five years old when he started cultivating this land. That was quite long ago but he never ceases because his passion for doing so urges him to go on working. At the end of the month, Wenceslao gets PHP 10,000, which he divides equally among his family. 

Wenceslao joined GDMPC to access financial services offered by the cooperative. He has borrowed PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Wenceslao plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mol, age fifty-seven, is a married woman and has three single children attending public schools. She resides in Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. To generate income to support her family, Mol makes and sells Khmer cakes from a rented booth in a junior high school. She is able to yield approximately USD 3.33 per day from this type of business.

So now, Mol would like to acquire her first loan. She will add it to her existing capital and buy household products to improve her standard of living. Mol hopes that this loan will be granted to her to develop her living conditions. She is very thankful for the great support to her family.

loans.use: to add to her existing capital to buy household products to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim is aged forty-seven. She is a married woman who has been blessed with four children, two of whom now are employed in various careers in Phnom Penh city. She currently lives with her husband and two unemployed children in Reussey Keo commune. Nim describes herself a humble farmer who owns only a few pieces of fertile land for farming. However, she is industrious in her business of cultivating rice in order to ensure a further education of her children. Nim has a life partner in her spouse who serves the people with his construction business.  

Nim is asking for her first loan from HKL to pay the fees of the construction workers who are fixing her house. This funding will provide her family a suitable and comfortable house. She is very happy and appreciates the great support from our generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay fees for the construction workers to fix her house.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
Choun is forty-three years old and is married with four single children. She permanently resides in Reussey Keo commune, where most Cambodian-Islamic people prefer to live. Choun works for a garment factory located not so far away from her house. Her schedule is from 7am to 5pm. But sometimes she has to work overtime to make extra money to meet her daily needs. In addition to this work, Choun owns a small general store in her home where she sells a variety of products to serve the people in her neighborhood. 

At this time, Choun is experiencing financial difficulties. Her present stock of merchandise has gradually run out. In order to make a stable business, Choun would like to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy merchandise to replenish her stock. With the increase in income, Choun will be able to save some of it to improve her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is fifty years old and married with fourteen children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
Fannie is sixty-seven years old and married.

Fannie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fannie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fannie has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed eighteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fannie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gracilla

texts.en:
Gracilla is forty-seven years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gracilla is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Gracilla has been raising livestock for one year and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is forty-nine years old and married with four children.

Ma. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Victoria has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Ma. Victoria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mayonita

texts.en:
Mayonita is sixty-one years old and married with four children.

Mayonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mayonita has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twelve years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mayonita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is fifty-three years old and married with six children.

Pilar works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Pilar has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Pilar aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Renebeth

texts.en:
Renebeth is thirty-seven years old and married with one child.

Renebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Renebeth has borrowed and paid for two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Renebeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is thirty-two years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

In the future Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. Teresita earns more income from a general store, raising livestock and selling water.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is sixty years old and married with seven children.

Florida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Florida has borrowed and paid for twenty-one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Florida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juraita

texts.en:
Juraita is fifty-two years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Juraita works very hard to provide for them.

Juraita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Juraita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, eggs, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Juraita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is fifty years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Lucy works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as milk, spices, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, etc.

In the future Lucy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is forty-one years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Marlyn is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Marlyn has been buying and selling livestock for twenty-one years now, and has borrowed nineteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thirty-nine years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

In the future Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is forty-one years old and married with one child.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid for nineteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is forty-one years old and married with three children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, canned goods, soft-drinks etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twelve years and also earns an income from rice milling and hog raising.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to build a mini-grocery at a public market.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is thirty-four years old and has three children. Marivel is married and two of her children are in school.

Marivel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivel requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines.

Marivel has been raising pigs for fifteen years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivel would like to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a food production/sales business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for nineteen years.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yibeden Group

texts.fr:
Mme PHILOMENE est la représentante du groupe YIBEDEN. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans le moins âgé a 19ans. 03 de ses enfants  vont à l’école et elle a 08 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes baoulé et des bijoux. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne à ABIDJAN en Côte d’Ivoire .Ses clients sont les amis et les voisins.

Mme veut  s’acheter  30 pagnes baoulé et des bijoux.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Philomène is the representative of the Yibeden group. She is married and mother to six children, the eldest being 32 years old and the youngest 19. Three of her children are at school and she has eight dependents.

Philomène sells Baoulé "pagnes" (highly decorative pieces of fabric with a geometric design) and jewelry. She has been carrying out this activity for the past year and gets her supplies in Abidjan in the Ivory Coast. Her customers are friends and neighbors.

She wants to buy 30 Baoulé "pagnes" and jewelry.

She saves her profits and has an ambition to open a large shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy 30 Baoulé "pagnes" and jewelry

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Angelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
Berlyn is thirty years old and married with two children.

Berlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Berlyn has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Berlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Ma. Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock and ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Elvira has been in this business for twenty-three years. Ma. Elvira earns other income from buying and selling rice.

Ma. Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expaning her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a entertainment (videoke) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari sari (general) store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit and pay for the maintenance of her entertainment (videoke) machines.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase an additional unit and pay for the maintenance of her videoke machines.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is married with two children. Jovy is thirty-one years old and lives in Cahayag, Tudela.

Jovy is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. Jovy has been doing this for six years. Jovy has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic ones. 

Jovy has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jovy hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Fotemogoban sont mariées  majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec 43 ans en moyenne et 6 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Donsobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales (riz et mil), d’arachide et de pain. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Bintou (assise en 2ème position de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales dans le village de Donsobougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de mil en gros à la foire de Cinzana Gare. La revente s’effectuera au comptant  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Bintou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments
texts.en:
The eight women in the Fotemogoban group are married, the majority of them living in polygamous families and averaging 43 years of age with six children each. They all live in the village of Donsobougou in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and marriage. They all have small businesses selling cereals (rice and millet), groundnuts and bread. With a view to expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their first group loan.

Bintou (who is sitting second from the left towards the right of the photo) is a large seller of cereals in the village of Donsobougou and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy four sacks of millet from wholesalers at the Cinzana Gare fair. She will resell this for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan, Bintou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in the business and cover the restocking of condiments in the household.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Adidjatou est une femme  âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur.  Elle a 03 enfants. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Adidjatou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 1990. Elle exerce son activité avec 01 personne au marché.
Adidjatou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut agrandir son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adidjatou voudrait diversifier la marchandise.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Adidjatou is a 45-year old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children, the eldest being 22 years old and the youngest 18. Adidjatou has been working as a retailer of cereals since 1990 and carries out her business with another person in the market. She has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy cereals as she wants to expand her business. In the coming years, Adidjatou would like to diversify the merchandise she sells. She says that with the profits she makes she plans to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Borrower Bayasgalan is a thirty-four-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Bayasgalan supports her family, by operating a clothing retail stall business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been doing this for eight years. She sells clothes which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Though she is still paying back her previous Kiva loan, she is requesting an additional loan of 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase more clothing for the spring and in order to increase her working capital after a traditional Mongolian holiday. 

This is her third Kiva loan and she is one of the very trusted and repeat clients of Transcapital CoLtd., who is thankful to all the wonderful Kiva lenders in the world.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell this spring.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.en:
Elmo is married with no children. Elmo is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elmo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

Elmo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elmo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

location.town: Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with seven children. Rosana is forty-four years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosana is a farmer and breeds pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase little pigs, feed and vitamins.

Rosana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase little pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is married with five children. Annabella is fifty-eight years old and lives in the Philippines.

Annabella is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for thirty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Annabella has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Annabella hopes to have enough savings for her family future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is thirty-eight years old and lives in Mialen,Clarin. Arceli is married with three children. 

Arceli works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. Arceli has been doing this for twenty years. Arceli has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Arceli has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Arceli hopes to expand her business.
