She is 51 years old and did not attend school. Sidonie is a widow but has five children, some of whom have had schooling. All the children are in her care. She lives with her children and is alone in meeting household expenses. 

To cope with her difference expenses, Sidonie has been selling undergarments out of her home for nearly fifteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Concerned about bolstering her business further and responding better to the demands of her customers, Sidonie would like to increase her inventory of good. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHUENA, a second loan from Alidé. The first loan received was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy undergarments

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Luzviminda is borrowing a loan of PHP 19,500 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase equipment for fishing boat maintenance.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 41 years old and married with 5 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Daisy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and equipment. Daisy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Grace De Dieu Group

texts.fr: GRACE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jocelyne Bamidélé (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Rachad. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Jocelyne Bamidélé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Jocelyne Bamidélé a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Depuis cinq ans, Jocelyne Bamidélé vend de carton de savons à travers un système de distribution. Jocelyne Bamidélé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Jocelyne Bamidélé et les autres membres du groupe GRACE DE DIEU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. le premier crédit à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
GRACE DE DIEU is a group made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Jocelyne Bamidélé (with her hand raised in the photograph), is 36 years old and married to a man named Rachad. The couple has two children, one of whom is in their care and attends school. Jocelyne Bamidélé lives with her husband and her children. Together, the couple covers the various household expenses.

Jocelyne Bamidélé did not go to school very often. For the past five years, Jocelyne Bamidélé has been selling boxes of soap through a distribution system. Jocelyne Bamidélé stocks up at a market in Benin.

This is the second time that Jocelyne Bamidélé and the other members of the GRACE DE DIEU group are seeking the financial support of ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better respond to the demands of their customers. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap

loans.name: Djromahuton Nigniwiwa Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON NIGNIWIWA est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ginette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est mariée à un pasteur du nom Valère. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ginette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près d’une dizaine d’années, Ginette vend des balles de friperies à son domicile et aussi à travers le système de distribution. Ginette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Afin de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus grande de sa clientèle, Ginette et les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON NIGNIWIWA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Djromahuton Nigniwiwa group is made up of two people living in the same neighbourhood. The representative of the group, Ginette (pictured here with her hand raised), is married to a pastor named Valère.  The couple has three children, all in school, and in their care.  Ginette lives together with her children and husband, and works together with him to take care of the various needs of the household.

For almost a decade, Ginette has been selling sacks of used clothing from her home, as well as through a distribution system. Ginnette stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to better meet the growing demand of her clientele, Ginette and the Djromahuton Nigniwiwa group are asking for a loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBEDOKPO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Généviève (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Imorou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Généviève vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis quinze ans, Généviève vend des balles de friperies et des sachets de pur water à son domicile et aussi à travers un système de distribution. Généviève s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Généviève et les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. le premier crédit à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
GBEDOKPO is a group of four persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Généviève (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a man named Imorou. They have three children, some of whom have had schooling. Two of the children are in their care. Généviève lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For fifteen years, Généviève has been selling bales of used clothing and pouches of Pur water out of her home and also through the distribution system. Généviève gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the second time she and the other members of the group GBEDOKPO have requested financial support from Alidé for bolstering their working capital and their businesses, as well as to respond further to the demands of their customers. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing and pouches of Pur water.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 65 years old and married with 8 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old, married, and has six children. With three children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them. 

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. 

Teresita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, noodles, egg, etc. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Roswin

texts.en: This time, for her ninth loan, Roswin is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) with which she intends to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing. This business was previously funded through this Kiva partner and NWTF continues to provide her and her family with loans that are improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Yemalin Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN est composé de treize personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Delphine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Delphine est mariée à un certain Casimir. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Delphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Delphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Delphine vend de riz et d’huile végétale à son domicile. Delphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Delphine et les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle et par la suite d'augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Yemalin Group is made up of 13 people living in the same neighbourhood in Benin.  the representative of this group, Delphine, is pictured here with her hand raised.  Delphine is married to a man named Casimir. The couple has four children, all in their care.  Some of the children are in school.  Delphine has not attended school.  Delphine lives together with her children and husband, and shares with him the responsibility of providing for the various household needs.

For five years, Delphine has sold rice and vegetable oil from her home.  Delphine stocks up at a market in Benin.  This is the fourth time that Delphine and the other members of the Yemalin Group are asking for a loan through ALIDé. This loan will allow them to reinforce their businesses so as to better respond to the demands of their clientele, consequently raising their turnover.  The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase sacs of rice and drums of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Proculo

texts.en:
Proculo is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 10 children. Proculo has run a business providing motorcycle services for 10 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools and gasoline for his services. Proculo has been a member of Kiva's partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for  his motorcycle services business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 25 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Mary Joy runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more products to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc. In the future Mary Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a loan of PHP 23,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 43 years old, married, and has two children. 

Gilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to customers. 

Gilda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 16 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. 

Gilda aspires to save enough to buy more farmland and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 49 years old, married and has 1 child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ignacia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store. Ignacia has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks and beverages. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
Rosabella works hard to support her family. Rosabella is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years now, and also earns additional income from sari-sari store.

Rosabella requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, Rosabella would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a banana retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Helen requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Evelyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothing. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 22 years old and is excited to be expecting her first child. All her life she has lived in Lusaka, but now she runs her own mobile money transfer business in a small town called Kafue.
 
Tamara first got started working as a money transfer teller in her brother-in-law’s shop when she was 19 years old. She worked there for over two years and got to know everything there is to know about the business. She then underwent an intense training period and in September 2011, she was given her own shop to run in Kafue. 

This was only the beginning. She has grown into a full-blown business woman who goes above and beyond to make sure her customers are happy. Her customers benefit from her business because there is no need to open an account. She is also located right in the heart of Kafue so customers do not have to go far to do their money transfers. 

Her biggest business concern is that she is not able to give her customers the fastest possible service because she has problems accessing the internet due to the poor signal at her shop. She also worries about sometimes having to  ask her customers to wait, as she rushes to the bank and back, to get money to serve them. 
 
Tamara is sure that a loan from Kiva will change her business because it will give her the money she needs to buy a computer and increase her working capital.

Her hope is for her business to start making more profit by the time she has her baby. 

In her video, Tamara is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy a small computer

loans.name: Mutale

texts.en:
Mutale is 21 years old and the firstborn in a family of five. He just completed his high school education. As the owner of a small money transfer shop, he is his family’s sole breadwinner. 

All the transactions at his shop are done using mobile phones which makes things faster and easier for his customers. The main challenge Mutale faces is the availability of shop space. This is what he sees as the biggest obstacle to expanding his business. Previously he served around 700 customers a month, but this number has now grown to over 1,000 pushing his shop to the limits of its capacity.

When Mutale gets his Kiva loan, he intends to increase his shop space to cater for his ever increasing number of customers. Mutale’s biggest dream is to some day expand to all the rural areas of Zambia. 

Mutale intends to use the profits from his business expansion to pay his way through college. Also, because his family depends on him financially, he also wants to help his younger siblings complete their high school education. 

In the video, Mutale is being interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions Zambia (MTZ).

loans.use: To increase his shop space so that he can serve more customers and use the profit to pay for his college tuition.

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a DVD/VCD tape-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more DVD/VCDs to sell to customers.

Analita has been in this business for 14 years. Analita also earns more income from raising livestock.

Analita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough income to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more DVD/VCDs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Editha has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for selling.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 31-years-old and is married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 54-years-old and is married with 2 children. Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell at her store.

Natividad has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, shampoo, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Natividad would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purcahse additional products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 61-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Meri has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy snacks, biscuits and candies for selling.

Meri has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Meri hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, biscuits and candies for selling.

loans.name: Abdullozoda

texts.ru: Абдуллозода трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. С 2007 году он занимается услугой грузоперевозок. В этом бизнесе помогает ему брат. Абдуллозода запрашивает займ для перевозки и в последующим реализации картошки в другом районе, так как спрос на картошку в этом районе очень большой и этот бизнес может быть прибыльным для него. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Abdullozoda is a hardworking and conscientious family man. Since 2007 he has been providing a transportation service. His brother helps him in this business. 

Abdullozoda requests a loan for transport and subsequent sale of potatoes in a different region, as the demand for potatoes in this region is very large and this business can be very profitable for him. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to transport and sell in a different region

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo Alto se encuentra está formado por 12 socias quienes son mujeres luchadoras, amables, gentiles y sobre todo trabajadoras, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir  adelante con sus familias. Viven por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos los mismos que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su gente es amable, de un corazón cálido y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana, tiene 57 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de los cuales 5 son casados y viven independientes, un hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su último hijo  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión relojero, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Mariana es de profesión costurera, esta actividad la aprendió estudiando y tiene con 28 años de experiencia, realiza toda clase de prendas de vestir, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. Como pasa en casa tiene tiempo para la criar cuyes y cerdos.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito, el cual lo va a invertir en la  compra de  telas, hilos, cierres y botones para su taller, y también va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer unos arreglos en su casa.
 
Su meta es tener un taller de costura más grande.
texts.en:
The village bank Yanaturo Alto is made up of 12 women who are hardworking, friendly and kind. They work in different activities that allow them to cover their living costs and to make progress for their families. They all live in the city of Cuenca, a World Heritage Cultural Site since 1999, which is bathed by 4 rivers which give their name to Saint Ana of the Four Rivers. The people are friendly and warm-hearted, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their town.

One of the members is Mariana, 57, who is married and has 7 children; five of them are married and live apart, one single son works and helps her financially, and her youngest son is in high school in the city. Her husband is a watchmaker and they live in a home that they own.

Mariana is a seamstress, a trade that she began studying some 28 years ago. She makes all sorts of garments, working from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. Since she works at home she also has time to raise guinea pigs and hogs. 

This is her second loan with the village bank and she will use it to buy fabric, thread, zippers and buttons for her workshop, and also to buy construction materials to make some repairs to her house.

Her goal is to have a bigger sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and construction materials.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 34 years old. Marilyn has a food stall business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods, meats, and pork to sell in her food stall. Marilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods, meats, and pork to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Zosima requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aysel

texts.ru:
Etoy molodoy devushke 22 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Aysel uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Ona ochen nujdayetsya v 2350 AZN chtobi kupit neskalko korov dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Tak kak ona xochet uvelichit svoi mesachniye doxodi i uludshit soderjaniye semyi . Ona ochen lubit svoix ditey i muja.
 Aysel yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy.Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
This young woman is 22 years old. She is married and has one child. Aysel has been engaged in livestock breeding for 2 years, she breeds cows. She needs 2350 AZN in order to buy some cows for growing her business, as she wants to increase her monthly income and improve the family's conditions. She loves her husband and child very much. 

Aysel is an internally displaced person (IDP), she migrated from city of Fuzuli, currently she lives in the Fuzuli region together with her friendly family. An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Sheila is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the services.
Sheila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Sheila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for  gasoline

loans.name: Zharienne

texts.en:
Zharienne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her internet cafe business.

Zharienne has been in this business for 2 years. Zharienne earns additional income from a general store.

Zharienne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 32 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aileen is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins.

Aileen has been raising pigs  for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy a tricycle for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Maria Arlene

texts.en:
Maria Arlene is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Maria Arlene is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She is also providing funeral services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle services.
Maria Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in yambio. She has a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 24 years old, married, and has one child who is not in school. 
Gloria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising chickens. Alma is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for making her dried fish.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for making her dried fish.

loans.name: Djahid Guseynov

texts.ru:
Djahid nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti dlya prodaji v magazine. Kak vi videte na fotografii v danniy moment u nego imeyetsya ochen malo produktov dlya prodaji i poeotmu on ne mojet xorosho zarabativat ,dlya etogo on i nujdayetsya v kredite chtobi razvit svoy bizness. 
Djahid uje 26 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet semyi, no v budushem on planiruyet jenitsya i postroit svoyu semyu. Djahid jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami, on yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Djahid needs 1600 AZN in order to purchase needed products for selling in his store. As you can see in the picture, he currently has very few products for sale and he is therefore not able to get a good income. For this he also needs credit in order to develop his business. Djahid is already 26 years old. He is not married and he does not have children, but in the future he plans to marry and build a family. 

Djahid lives in the Fuzuli region together with his parents, he is an internally displaced person migrating from the city of Fuzuli. An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy products for selling in his store

loans.name: Gulaziya

texts.ru: Гулазие  54 года, вдова, воспитала двух детей.   В 1997 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулазия начала свой бизнес в торговле, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Гулазия сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Гулазия  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Гулазия  планирует частично вложить в ремонт квартиры, и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulaziya is 54 years old, a widow, and has raised two children. In 1997, in the search of a source of income for her family, Gulaziya started her business in commerce with a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and hard work, Gulaziya was able to develop her business to a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS). 

Currently the assortment of goods is not abundant, and for this reason Gulaziya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for broadening the assortment of goods. Gulaziya plans to invest the income from the loan partly in repairing her apartment and party in developing her business.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Rashid

texts.ru: Рашид проживает в городе Дангара. Он занимается разведением крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области он шесть лет. Он женат. Ему 36 лет. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для закупа коз в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Rashid lives in the town of Dangara. He is engaged in breeding cattle, sheep and goats. He has been working in this area for six years. 

Rashid is married and 36 years old. He has four children. He takes a loan to purchase goats for reselling in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats for reselling

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.es: Arcelia  de 36 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 19 años de edad.  Ella tiene 12 años de vivir en la ciudad de Barranquilla desde que salió desde su natal Copey en el departamento del Cesar, buscando con su familia un mejor futuro para todos. Cuando llegó a casa de sus padres, comenzó a vender frutas para apoyar el gasto familiar, posteriormente empezó a comercializar con queso y suero  traído desde el Copey; con esta actividad han ido creciendo en familia y hoy cuentan con su propia casa. Su meta es continuar creciendo, para que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales de éxito. Mientras trabaja para lograr sus sueños,  maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 7 días, una rotación de inventarios de 2 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 40% . Su mayor desafío es obtener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para responder a la creciente clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, con el cual comprará frutas, verduras, ñame, ahuyama, queso y suero. Su inversión visiona su éxito, porque se fundamenta en pedidos de sus clientes y porque su experiencia potencializa un buen manejo de las transacciones.
texts.en:
Arcelia, 36, lives in the southwest of the city with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 6 to 19 years.  She’s been living in the city of Barranquilla for 12 years since she left her native Copey in Cesar Department with her family in search of a better future for all of them.  When she arrived at her parents’ house she started to sell fruit to help with family expenses and later on started to sell cheese and whey brought from Copey.  With this activity they’ve been growing together as a family and they now have a house of their own.  Her goal is to continue growing so that her children will become successful professionals.  

While working toward reaching her dreams, she manages an accounts receivable of 7 days and a two day stock inventory turnover; her profit margin on sales is no less than 40%.  Her greatest challenge is to obtain enough working capital to respond to growing clientele.  This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy fruit, vegetables, yams, pumpkins, cheese and whey.  Her investment augurs success because it’s based on prior customer orders and because her experience guarantees a good management of the transactions.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, yams, pumpkins, cheese and whey.

loans.name: Teresa Alonso Vueltas

texts.es: Teresa de 45 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad, con su esposo y tienen 3 hijas en las edades de 11 a 19 años. Allí tiene una tienda estadero que inició hace 3 años en casa de su madre. Ella comenzó con $300.000 Cop. y 10 canastas de cervezas, para atender a sus familiares cuando estos la visitaban, gradualmente se fue extendiendo por la acogida que tuvo en el sector y hasta logró obtener su propia vivienda. Hoy sueña con mejorar las condiciones físicas de su negocio y de su vivienda, para lograr un ambiente familiar y empresarial confortable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 100 canastas de cervezas, 36 bultos de arroz y aceite en mayor volumen. Para Teresa su inversión será exitosa, porque se fundamenta en su experiencia y en la posibilidad de vender a otros negocios bebidas y de incluir productos de la canasta familiar.
texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and lives in the southwest of the city with her husband.  They have three daughters from 11 to 19 years old.  There she has a store that she started three years ago in the house of her mother.  She started with $300,000 Colombian pesos and ten cases of beer.  In order to take care of her family members when they visited her, she gradually expanded because of the success she had in the sector and even achieved having her own house.  

Today she dreams of improving the physical conditions of her business and her house to achieve a family atmosphere and comfortable business.  She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase 100 cases of beer, 36 bags of rice, and oil in greater volume.  For Teresa her investment will be successful because it is based on her experience and on the possibility of selling drinks to other businesses and including products from the family shopping basket.

loans.use: to buy 100 cases of beer, 36 bags of rice and oil in greater volume.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 41 años de edad  es un hombre casado, que vive en un barrio tradicional del sur de la ciudad. Allí vende productos fritos y jugo naturale de  naranja. Inicialmente trabajaba para una empresa y la liquidaron, quedando cesante; con su liquidación emprendió su propia aventura de negocios y empezó vendiendo jugos naturales y fritos, con pocas herramientas y una mesa de trabajo, en la medida en que le fue yendo bien,  adquirió otros enseres y compró un pequeño carro y desde entonces han pasado 7 años y aun sigue funcionando cada vez, con  mejores resultados. Hoy su negocio está ubicado en el boulevard del barrio, frente a una terminal de transporte y es un lugar muy concurrido, por eso tiene la necesidad de crecer e invertir en él, ya que su clientela esta creciendo, pero su gran desafío es su capital de trabajo, con el que no alcanza a responder a la demanda de su mercado y al mejoramiento de sus condiciones de infraestructura.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un carro para jugos, una vitrina y materia prima para incrementar su oferta. Su meta es continuar creciendo, para lograr mayor prosperidad familiar y tener su propia casa la cual aumentaría el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Julio, 41, is a married man; he lives in a traditional neighborhood in the south of the city.  He sells fried snacks and natural orange juice there.  Initially he was employed by a firm but it went out of business and he was left unemployed.  With his severance pay he started his adventure in his own business and started selling natural fruit juice and fried snacks.  With few tools and a work table as he did better he acquired more equipment and bought a small cart.  Seven years have passed since then and he continues in operation with better results each time.  Today his business is located at a very busy spot so he needs to grow and invest in it since his clientele is expanding but his great challenge is working capital which is insufficient to meet market demand and to improve the conditions of his infrastructure.

This is the reason for his calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy a juice cart, a display case and raw materials to increase his offer.  His goal is to continue to grow to attain greater family prosperity and to have a house of his own which would increase his home’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a juice cart, a dislpay case and raw materials to increase inventory.

loans.name: Ma.cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 46,000 through NWTF to buy items such as chips, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc., for sale.

Prior to this loan, Ma. Cecilia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns income from selling dried fish.

Ma. Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as chips, soft-drinks, and canned goods for sale

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns income from food vending. Maricel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Berna has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Berna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pilagia

texts.en:
Pilagia is 54 years old and widowed with seven children. With 3 children in school, Pilagia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Pilagia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, cigarettes and other groceries. In the future, Pilagia would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Lourdes is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as bread, soft-drinks, beverages and other groceries. Lourdes has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Lourdes would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, soft-drinks, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana  de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 11 años, al sur de la ciudad en un barrio que combina escenarios deportivos profesionales, comercio formal e informal, conjuntos residenciales y viviendas. Ella inició su negocio  de vender  productos fritos, como arepas, empanadas, chorizos, papas rellenas, chuzo y chinchurria,  desde el año 2011; su principal clientela la conforman vecinos y visitantes del sector, que le compran de contado todos los días, pues trabaja de lunes a jueves desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche  y de viernes a domingo, desde las 4 hasta las 12 de la noche.  En este sector aunque la competencia es alta,  todos se conocen y compiten, mientras ella se sostiene con precios justos, amabilidad y calidad en sus productos. Su mayor desafío es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, porque para sus proyecciones le hace falta capital de trabajo y  un mayor equipo humano para lograr sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, como aceite, masa, sal, carne, queso en mayor volumen, para atender su cada vez mas creciente demanda. Mientras Diana trabaja para cumplir sus sueños, maneja una liquidez de 1,35%, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 44%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Diana, 32, lives with her husband and two children who are 9 and 11 years old in the south of the city in a neighborhood that combines professional sports venues, formal and informal commerce, residential developments and homes.  She started her business selling fried snacks like arepas [stuffed, grilled corn cakes], turnovers, sausages, stuffed potatoes, brochettes and fried tripe since 2011.  Her main clientele is formed by neighbors and visitors to the sector who buy and pay cash daily because she works Monday through Thursday from 4 in the afternoon until 10 at night and Fridays through Sundays from 4 until midnight.  Competition is high in this sector.  Everyone knows each other and competes but she stays in business with fair prices, kindness and the quality of her products.  Her greatest challenge is attaining business growth because she lacks working capital for her projections and more staff to reach her dreams.

She is applying for a Kiva loan at present, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy raw materials like oil, dough, salt, meat and cheese at higher volume to meet ever expanding demand.  While Diana works to reach her dreams she has 1.35% liquidity and a profit margin on sales of no less than 44%, financial indicators from which we predict growth for her.

loans.use: to buy oil, dough, salt, meat and cheese in greater volume.

loans.name: Jair Enrique Acosta Zambrano

texts.es: Jair  de 26 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad y tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de internet, fotocopiado y llamadas. Su negocio inició hace un año después de haber trabajado administrando un café internet, en un sector del norte de la ciudad, donde adquirió toda su experiencia. Así fue como se ideó con su novia,  empezar este mismo negocio y ella arrendó un local y el puso los equipos e iniciaron su aventura de trabajo. En su negocio cada día crece su clientela y en diferentes épocas no es capaz de responder a esta demanda y esto se ha convertido en el gran desafío para su crecimiento,  porque no tienen el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará,  tres equipos de cómputos y una fotocopiadora mas, con los cuales se preparan para atender la gran demanda de estudiantes, que se aglomera para hacer tareas y trabajar en internet. Su meta mas adelante, es lograr un ambiente cada vez mas confortable y generar empleos , pero eso si en un local propio el cual es el sueño de esta pareja.
texts.en:
Jair, 26, lives in the south of the city and has a business through which he provides Internet access services, photocopying and phone calls.  His business started a year ago after having finished running an Internet café in a sector in the north of the city where he acquired all his experience.  This is how he got the idea with his girlfriend to start this same kind of business.  She rented a locale and he installed the equipment and they started their adventure in work.  His business’ clientele is growing every day and there are times when he’s unable to meet demand which has become his great challenge for growth because they don’t have enough working capital to do so.

This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy three sets of computer equipment and another photocopier which will prepare them to take care of the great demand they have from students that crowd in to do homework and to work in the Internet.  His goal for later on is to attain an environment that’s more comfortable each time and to generate employment but this time in a locale of their own which is this couple’s dream.

loans.use: to buy three computers and another photocopier.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Raquel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es: Alcibíades  de 57 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 17 años. Allí tiene un negocio de reciclaje y otro de venta de repuestos de electrodomésticos . Desde hace 30 años aprendió el oficio de reparación de abanicos y licuadoras  y desde el año 1994 consiguió la oportunidad de negociar con chatarras. Gracias a estos dos negocios, ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar y adquirió  también vivienda propia. Su meta mas adelante es organizar muy bien sus dos negocios e independizarlos totalmente de su hogar, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente,  para lograr este propósito de manera inmediata. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, para empezar a incrementar su capital de trabajo y poco a poco lograrlo. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales reciclables, como hierro, cobre, bronce y aluminio, pues tiene un deposito como su principal cliente que esta dispuesto a comprar estos productos, así este dinero rotará rápidamente y  allí radicará el efecto positivo que tendría esta inversión. Así mismo comprará repuestos de abanicos, licuadoras  y ollas, que son los artículos que mas vende en su negocio y siempre requiere tener inventarios, para responder rápidamente a su clientela.
texts.en:
Alcibíades, 57, lives in the municipality of Malambo, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with his wife and three children whose ages range from 2 to 17 years old. There he owns a recycling business and another business where he sells spare parts for appliances. 
He has repaired fans and blenders for 30 years, and in 1994 he started a business of selling and buying scrap. Thanks to these two businesses, he has managed to support his family and get his own house. 
His long-term goal is to get his two businesses well organized and separate them completely from his house, but his working capital is not enough to immediately reach this goal. This is why he asks for a Kiva loan in order to increase his working capital and reach his goal with time. 
This Kiva loan is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy materials for recycling, such as iron, copper, bronze and aluminum, as he has a deposit from his main customer who is willing to buy these products, so this money will flow quickly, that is why this investment would have a positive effect. 
He will also buy spare parts for fans, blenders and saucepans, as these are the items which he sells the most and he always has to have inventories to meet the needs of his customers in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for recycling, such as iron, copper, bronze and aluminum and spare parts for fans, blenders and saucepans.

loans.name: Edwin Mauricio Leyva Garcia

texts.es: Edwin  de 28 años, es un joven casado que  tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años.  Él es un trabajador que logra sostener su familia,  a partir de un negocio mediante el cual elabora calzado,  para damas, caballeros y niños, desde el año 2010 cuando inició en el patio de su casa con herramientas muy rudimentarias; poco a poco compró equipamiento y trasladó su negocio a una habitación que acondicionó como su taller, hoy no solo ocupa este cuarto, sino casi toda su casa, pues su negocio ha crecido y cada vez mas, los pedidos aumentan y con ello la tenido que adicionar primero un ayudante,  posteriormente agregó dos mas y hoy cuenta con 3 zapateros, un cortador, un guarnecedor y él mismo, quien trabaja en todo el proceso productivo  especialmente el de diseño, mientras su esposa está a cargo de la comercialización. Con el crecimiento de su negocio,  su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para lograr responder a su demanda en el mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, suelas, forros, sintéticos, una dobladora, una cortadora de tiras, una vitrina y hormas. Su sueño es abrir un local comercial y crecer como empresa exportadora de calzado, este último es su gran desafío  .
texts.en:
Edwin, 28, is a young married man who has three children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years.  He is a worker who manages to support his family through a business making shoes for women, men and children.  He started the business in 2010 in his patio with very rudimentary tools.  Little by little he bought a more equipment and moved his business into a room that he set up as his workshop.  Today, he not only occupies this room but almost all of the house because his business has grown and each time his orders increase to such a degree that he had to employ a helper and later on two more so that he now has three cobblers, a cutter, a decorator and himself who works in the entire productive process especially in design; his wife takes care of the sales.

With the growth of his business his working capital becomes insufficient to meet market demand which is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy larger amounts of soles, lining, synthetics, a folder, a strip cutter, a display case and shoe trees.  His dream is to open a store and to become a shoe exporting firm; this last is his great challenge.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 51 years old and a widowed mother of three children. With one child in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for her family.

Concepcion runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store. Concepcion has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned good, soft-drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Charwyl

texts.en:
Charwyl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Charwyl has a shop where he makes and sells homemade sausage like chorizo & longganisa. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Charwyl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell craft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her shell craft business.

Cornelia has been in this business for 30 years. Cornelia earns more income from a variety store.

Cornelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell craft business.

loans.name: Faride Esther Carbonó Pacheco

texts.es: Faride  está muy contenta con su anterior credikiva,  pues con él logró comprar una vitrina, cosméticos, accesorios y detalles para el hogar, que vendió rápidamente. Su negocio ha mejorado sustancialmente desde que recibió su credikiva y hoy está aplicando a un segundo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará bolsos, tratamientos capilares, ropa, calzado, pues tiene varios pedidos con los que responderá a sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Les agradezco que me hayan permitido salir adelante en mi `proyecto de vida gracias a ustedes y a Dios especialmente he logrado fortalecer mi negocio. “
texts.en: Faride is very pleased with her previous Kiva loan. She was able to use it to buy a display cabinet, cosmetics, accessories and home goods, which she sold on quickly. Her business has improved substantially since she received her Kiva loan and she is now applying for a second one. She will use it to buy handbags, hair products, clothes and footwear – she has a lot of client orders to fulfil. This is her message to Kiva’s lenders: “Thank you for having allowed me to progress with my project, which is so important to me. Thanks to you and to God in particular, I have succeeded in building up my business”.

loans.use: buy handbags, hair products, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque está interesado en comprarse más herramientas de trabajo, que le faciliten y agilicen más su trabajo, comprara una máquina de coser industrial, esto le ayudara para mejorar la sastrería y el trabajo que le realiza a los clientes.
El considera que a través del préstamo anterior pudo mejorar la operacionalidad de la sastrería y generar otros ingresos.
texts.en: Luis decided on a new loan because he’s interested in buying more work tools that will make his work easier and faster.   He will buy an industrial sewing machine that will help him improve his tailor shop and the work he does for customers.  He believes that his previous loan helped him improve the tailor shop’s efficiency and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 28 years old, married, and has four children, of which three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ethel has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

Ethel has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has runs a business of selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Arlyn is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more drinking water to sell. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Emilio nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 44 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él  es profesor y ya son 14 años que se dedica a enseñar educación primaria, él es también músico y toca instrumentos de viento como por ejemplo quenas y zampoñas, él también se dedica a escribir libros acerca de la cosmovisión andina.  Emilio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para impresión de la nueva edición de los libros.

Emilio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Emilio belongs to the community bank called Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Emilio was born in the city of Lamay and is 44 years old. He lives in the city where he was born and where her works. He is a teacher and has been teaching in the primary school for 14 years. He is also a musician and plays wind instruments such as a type of flute and pan pipes. He also writes books about the Andean worldview. Emilio needs a loan now to print a new edition of his books. 
Emilio is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to print the new edition of the books.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Wilber nació en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 48 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad de Lamay y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él  tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la agricultura. Wilber en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para abastecer la tienda y va comprar por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Wilber agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Wilber belongs to the community bank called Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Wilber was born in the city of Calca and is 48 years old. He lives in the city of Lamay and also works there. He has a small grocery store and is also a farmer. At this time, Wilber needs a loan to buy merchandise to stock his store and is going to buy, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, and other basic groceries. 
Wilder is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, and other basic groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yambio. She sells bread and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school.

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase bread to resell. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to resell.

loans.name: Eudecia

texts.en:
Eudecia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Eudecia has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Eudecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Rene nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 32 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la elaboración de cerámica y pintado de la cerámica, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde pinta y elabora artesanía. Rene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo para elaborar artesanía y va comprar por ejemplo pintura, madera, esmaltes y otras cosas más.  

Rene agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rene belongs to the community bank called Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay which is part of Asociación Araiwa in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.
Rene was born in the city of Lamay and is 32 years old. He lives in the city where he was born and where he works. He works making ceramics and painting what he makes. He has a small workshop in his home where he paints and makes crafts. At this moment, Rene needs a loan to by work materials to make crafts and is going to buy, for example, paint, wood, enamels, and other things. 
Rene is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to make drafts and to buy, for example, paint, wood, enamels, and other things.

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Brenda residente en una colonia al sur San Lorenzo, ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, además ella y su familia viven en casa de sus padres.
Ella se dedica desde hace ya unos 11 años al negocio de venta y elaboración de pan, rosquillas, venta de lácteos, paletas y jugos naturales, su venta es ambulante en los caseríos y barrios aledaños a su comunidad, muy temprano visita escuelas, y viviendas para vender sus producto, y solicita el préstamo para compra de leña, azúcar, huevos, pan, lácteos, etc. 
Brenda con las utilidades que genere en su negocio desea mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y comprarles lo necesario para que ha ellos no les falte nada, y también desea incrementar el negocio para así tener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de Brenda es tener su propia casa y que su negocio crezca y sea  estable para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman who lives in a southern district of San Lorenzo. She is married with two children and the family lives in Brenda’s parents’ house.

For 11 years now her work has consisted in making and selling bread, doughnuts, dairy products, ice-lollies and fresh juices. She travels around the local area selling her products in nearby villages and neighbourhoods. She goes out very early to sell her products to schools and households. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy firewood, sugar, eggs, bread, dairy products etc.

Brenda aims to use the income generated by her business to send her children to school and buy them what they need so that they never want for anything. She would also like to grow her business so that she can increase her profits. 

Brenda’s dream is to have her own house and to grow her business so that it is stable and she is able to provide her children with a better quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood, eggs, flour, sugar, milk and other products for her business

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: This time, for her 13th loan cycle, Ethel is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her food production business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Ethel and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Thelma would like to build and expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
Ma. Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafts business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lydia requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Ma. Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in Gaza. On the 1st of May 2011, Kawthar opened her mini market. She hopes to use this loan to improve her market by purchasing shelves, display boxes, and a refrigerator in order to be able to sell a wider variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, display boxes, and a refrigerator for her mini market.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. Rachel is married and has a personal products sales business in the Philippines.

Rachel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more body lotions, deodorants, perfume, and other personal products.

Rachel has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more body lotion, deodorant, perfume, and other personal products.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is 21-year-old single man from Gaza. He has a clothing store; he started his project on the 1st of June 2011. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy shelves, an AC, and new clothes for his store, thus he would able to improve his business, leading to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy shelves, an AC, and new clothes for his store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school.

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use the extra income from her business as a result of this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  de 52 años de edad vive muy cerca al escenario deportivo más importante de la ciudad de Barranquilla, la Costa caribe y Colombia, donde juegan equipos profesionales de futbol. En este barrio compuesto por múltiples alternativas productivas, formales e informales, él tiene también su pequeño almacén donde vende ropa de bebe, que confecciona en su propio taller, desde que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 10 años para radicarse, procedente de su natal departamento de Santander y emprender en el año 2000 su propio negocio, como es usual en la cultura de los oriundos de este departamento; Carlos muy pronto conquistó una clientela conformada por vecinos que hoy le compran al por mayor y almacenes de la Costa Atlántica;  con ellos  gradualmente ha ido incrementando su clientela y aunque maneja una alta competencia, pero se sostiene con precios justos y calidad en sus productos y el servicio. Sus clientes le pagan a 30 o a 60 días, esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, segundo financiamiento que hace a esta organización y primer credikiva, con el cual planea  financiar su cartera, comprando con este capital materias primas y accesorios para elaborar ropa de bebe y otros artículos como cunas, toldos, pañaleras, caminadores etc. Su inversión tendrá èxito porque conoce muy bien su mercado y tendrá un capital de trabajo adicional para hacer compras en más volumen que el acostumbrado, lo que se convierte en una ventaja competitiva para negociar precios. Con su crédito anterior logró adquirir mayor liquidèz, vitrina y en consecuencia ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 52, lives very near the most important sports venue in the city of Barranquilla, the Caribbean coast and Colombia where professional soccer games are played.  This neighborhood has many formal and informal productive  alternatives.  He has a small store where he sells clothing for infants that he has been making in his own shop since he moved to Barranquilla ten years ago to live here.  He came from his native Santander Department in 2000 to start his own business as is usual for natives of this department.  

Very quickly Carlos won over a clientele made up of neighbors who now buy from him at wholesale and stores on the Atlantic coast.  He’s gradually been increasing his clientele with them even though he has a lot of competition but he stays in business thanks to fair prices and quality products and service.  

His customers pay him in 30 or 60 days and this is why he’s calling on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, his second loan from this institution and first from Kiva that he plans to use to finance his portfolio buying raw materials and accessories to make clothes for infants and other items like cradles, covers, diaper bags, walkers, etc.

His investment will be successful because he knows his market very well and he’ll have additional working capital to buy in volumes higher than usual which is a competitive edge in negotiating prices.  He managed to attain greater liquidity and a display case with his previous loan consequently improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and accessories to make baby clothes and other items like cradles, covers, diaper bags, walkers, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Romeo Rodriguez

texts.es:
Don Oscar de 45 años de edad, es casado vive con sus cuatro hijos, su esposa esta en España y le apoya económicamente a través de las remesas que ella  le envía, tiene casa propia ubicada en una colonia de san Lorenzo.
 Don Oscar se dedica desde hace 21 años a la actividad de construcción de casas, con esta actividad a podido salir adelante con su familia, y solicita el préstamo para compra de cemento ya que esta construyendo una casa para habitar el y su familia.
A través de este préstamo podrá terminar su casa ya que necesita el material para ponerle el piso y de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y la su familia.
El sueño de Don Oscar es instalar un negocio en su casa ya que necesita más ingresos para terminar de graduar a sus hijos que están estudiando en la escuela y el colegio.

San Lorenzo, honduras – Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old. He is married and lives with his 4 children. His wife is in Spain and she supports him with the remittences that she sends home. He has his own home located in San Lorenzo.
Oscar has been working in construction for 21 years, building houses. Thanks to this work, he has been able to get ahead with his family. He is requesting the loan to buy cement as he is building a house for himself and his family.
This loan will enable him to finish his house and he needs the material to pour the floor. This will improve his quality of life and that of his family.
Oscar's dream is to open a business in his home as he needs more income so that his children can finish their education (they are in grade  school and high school).
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy cement to pour the floor for his house.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina  de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un nieto que depende de ella, tiene casa propia, su casa esta ubicada en San Lorenzo.
Doña Martina se dedica desde hace unos 9 años a elaborar y vender tortillas para los vecinos de la comunidad, muy temprano todo los días de lunes a domingo prepara en dos jornada las tortillas para ser vendidas en su casa, hasta su casa llegan los clientes que ella tiene a comprarle sus tortillas, a Doña Martina le ayuda  una de sus hijas a preparar sus tortillas.
Doña Martina esta solicitando 7,000.00 lempiras a PRISMA  para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar sus tortillas. 
Con las ganancias de su negocio ella  le compra medicina a su nieto y le compra la ropa que usa en la escuela.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su negocio y su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Martina is 52 and a single mother.  She has one grandson who depends on her.  She has her own home, which is located in San Lorenzo.  Doña Martina has made and sold tortillas to neighbors in her community for 9 years.  She makes them very early every day from Monday through Sunday to sell in her home.  Her customers go to her home to buy their tortillas.  One of her daughters helps her make the tortillas.  Doña Martina is requesting 7,000 lempiras from Prisma to buy corn and firewood to make her tortillas.  With the earnings from her business, she will buy medicine for her grandson and buy him clothes to wear for school.  Her dream is to keep working to help her business and family get ahead.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. She is widowed and runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years.

Angelina is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a resident of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. She is aged 31 and has a family of four children aged between 13 and 8 years. Her farm currently produces milk, which she sells to the local Kokiche dairy cooling plant, and tea, which goes to the local market in general.

Nancy has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy a dairy cow. She hopes the loan will improve her farming income and make life much better.

She laments of harsh weather conditions but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's fast loan processing.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: German Barraza Arias

texts.es: German vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 21 años respectivamente; allí se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, oficio que aprendió cuando un zapatero llegó a esta población, puso un taller y German trabajó como su ayudante durante varios años. Así mismo vende productos agrícolas de manera estacionaria, es decir en cada cosecha, esta  actividad la aprendió por tradición de su padre quien la practicaba.  Con estas actividades ha logrado generar el sustento de su hogar y ha sido apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 2 años. Con los financiamientos de esta organización, ha logrado tener en sus manos un capital de trabajo mas, para poder hace negociaciones  efectivas, pues antes trabajaba con créditos costosos de particulares y en manos de ellos quedaba la mayor parte de las ganancias que producía su trabajo.
